Her view of the Jacobite rebellion for King James of Scotland and his ill-fated attempt to restore his monarchy gave a sense of the passion of those who opposed the joining of Scotland and Engkand..  In the meantime, while writing the book, Carrie was getting in a romance with a one of two brothers, both of whom were courting her.
This was a good romantic easy read historical fiction book.  I love this time period.  Writer reminds of Diana Gabaldon.
My god. This book was amazing, I dont need to regurgitate (sp) the other reviews. If I could give it 200 stars I would.
I will admit that I was looking for a romance that was a little different but wow. I bawled like a baby and loved it.
The book kept my interest and was a quick read.  It was a bit "romantic" for my taste but not over the top.
Wasn't what I was expecting at all, much better.  Never read a book like this, very interesting and we'll written.

What a wonderful read. I didn't want to put this down! The author writes so beautifully and I found myself completely drawn into the story. I also grew to care very deeply for the characters.  It's definitely not your typical shallow romance where the sex is completely described for you, with those scenes being the main focus.  On the contrary, "A Winter Sea,"is built around the characters and their story, and those scenes are maybe not so plentiful, but when they are told, are emotional and beautifully romantic.  The historical aspect of the book is descriptive and very interesting and seemed well researched. Among my favorite books are "The Bronze Horseman" and the "Outlander Series," and I would rank this book up with those. It's such a lovely emotional story. Tears were shed. I loved it!!

Not my usual type of book, but the Starz series, Outlander, has given me an interest in books set in Scotland. I found this book to be more interesting when it was set in the present. I skimmed several sections set at Slains in the 1700's. Sophia and the Countess were well developed as characters, but John Moray never really became more than a stock romantic handsome man. The author didn't give him enough personality and the build up of their romance was rather brief. Moray's uncle, Colonel Graeme, was given more personality and substance. The lead character Carrie exploring how she knew Sophia's history and researching genetic memory was the best part of the novel for me, and Carrie's relationship with Graham in the present. I don't think I'll be reading any more books by Susanna Kearsley. Back to mysteries for me!

I can't say that this book compares to Outlander in many ways other than being set in Scotland in the 18th century and having a number of Jacobite characters in it, but it stands alone as a fine novel in itself. Well-researched, well-written and rather poignant, I would recommend it heartily to anyone who might be interested in the time period or subject matter. I enjoyed the way Kearsley wove strands of the past and present into a believable and beautiful tapestry. It wasn't as sweeping as I normally prefer, but Kearsley has a knack for evoking much feeling with an economy of words. Without robbing her of any due credit for producing a very fine historical novel, I will say that her story stepped into the void left by Gabaldon's #8 book in the Outlander series and cured me of my cliffhanger blues.
This was a very good book, I love historical novels, and this combined the past and the present in an easy read
Awesome book. I love it so much I want to read it again!  I love the way Kearsley writes historical fiction.
Great book,loved the author. Was recommended by a friend it is her favorite book. We read it for book club.
Loved this book - and I love this author.  I have ready most of her books and will keep on reading them.

I literally just finished reading this book and I can barely begin to express how much I loved it! It's beautifully written with breathtaking imagery of Scotland's coast. I have never been to Scotland but I felt as though I was right there in the book. The novel is a mix of historical fiction and romance. I loved how the novel went back and forth between the protagonist Carrie in present day writing her book, and her novel itself. The parallels between Carrie's novel and the history she unearths during her research are startlingly alike. It's a fantastic page-turner and I look forward to reading more of Susanna Kearsley's novels. This is only the second of her novels I have read but I will definitely be reading them all. They are THAT good.
loved the story, the way the plot went and the great ending .look forward to reading more of her books

This is the first Susanna Kearsley book I have read. I started reading The Winter Sea while walking on the treadmill. The miles and hours flew by as I was pulled into this wonderful historic romance. I've always liked and read many historical novels, especially those with beautiful romantic characters. I've read several of Diana Gabaldon's novels and this book is every bit as goods those are. I was especially intrigued with the format of the story within the story; a  very clever way to connect the present to the past. I also enjoyed the section at the end of the story detailing the true history of the characters. I would definitely recommend this book to readers. I look forward to reading another Susanna Kearsley novel.
Such a good story and a great ending. I was so sad until... You just have to read it and find out!

I have newly discovered Susanna Kearsley and this is the third book of hers that I have read. So far, my favorite is Shadowy Horses. While this one is good, I don't love the ending...and, I think, neither did Kearsley, because she wrote a sequel, "The Firebird," which was quite compelling. It used a character from Shadowy Horses as well as continued the story of the Winter Sea. Each story can stand alone, of course. I'm a huge fan of historical fiction and thought she did a great job with the history of "King Jamie, the black haired king over the water." I definitely recommend it as an interesting, relatively "clean" love story (the sexual content is more implied in most parts).
I love everything she writes. Cannot put it down. She draws you in so you feel part of the story.

This book reminded me of the good historical romances that came out in the 80s which were well-written and for the most part historically accurate, or at least the historical characters didn't have a modern sensibility. Many "historical" romances turn me off when the chracters sound like they are from the current time. This was beatifully written and the period nicely captured. The concept this book introduced of genetic time-travelling was unique. An author I thought of while reading this is Diana Gabaldon. If you like the Outlander series, I think you would like this book also. This was my first Susanna Kearsley book and I look forward to reading another story by her based on this novel.

The Winter Sea was one of the most wonderful books I have read in a LONG time!  Since then no book has compared. It carried the reader away to another time and place. Since I read it I have reccomended it to many friends including other avid readers like myself.  Everyone that has read it loves it! The way Ms. Kearsley twists and winds the past and present together is flawless. Very interesting historical information and so other-worldly. The relationships that form and are "remembered" are amazing and heartbreaking. Until the very end of the book you truly don't know what the ending will be. A wonderful work of literature. So much fun to be carried away to a castle by the sea!

After I purchased this book, I wondered what had possessed me to do so.  I finally pulled it off the shelf and started to read.  There's lots of history - dates, characters, etc. - that was a bit confusing to me at times.  But after a few pages, I got into the flow of the story and was carried away to Scotland.  I used to love reading Victoria Holt and this book reminded me of her stories.  It was interesting how Carrie's story and Sophie's story mirrored each other in many ways.  I loved being in the present with Carrie, but then loved the past wth Sophie.  The author made these transistions flawless.  I loved the romance, sigh, and what a wonderful ending.

I was completely hooked from page one and couldn't stop. Since I'm a fan of Diana Gabalon's Outlanders series, the similar premise of bridging between modern and 18th century Scotland attracted me. While I love Outlander, I think the Winter Sea is actually better. The characters are more sophisticated and realistic, and the flow felt very natural. I loved both past and present equally. I guess my only criticism would be that I saw the ending coming a mile away and wish it had been a little more flushed out. Still, I'm putting five stars because overall it was amazing. It's a good thing this story isn't a series. I'd never get any work done.

I would've learned a lot more than I did. I thoroughly enjoyed every word of this book, even through the tears. For me, it was one of those "when can I get back to reading it" books. The kind that occupy my mind throughout the day, and influence my dreams during the night. I originally chose this book to read in hopes of filling the void Herself has left me with, but it turned out to be much more than the "fluff" I expected it to be; apples and oranges in the end. I would absolutely recommend this book to anyone really, especially to those who enjoy "historical fiction", as the author really did her homework (which is greatly appreciated).

Carrie McClellan is a author researching material for her new book in France. While visiting her friend in Scotland she gets the feeling that this is where he new story was meant to take place. The story Carrie beings to write is interwoven with Carries personal story in the current day. However as her book progresses she questions is she is writing or recalling the series of events she is putting on paper. The Winter Sea is a well written historical novel with just the right mix of well researched historical facts and personal drama that make you feel part of the time and place if Scotland in the early 1700's.

The Winter Sea has made me want to rent a cottage by the seaside of Scotland. I did get lost, in a wonderful way, with the descriptions of Slains and the surrounding countryside. Historical fiction is my favorite genre and the premise of the main character being a historical fiction writer was very interesting to me. I even enjoyed the creativity of the two different time periods woven in as genetic memory. However much I enjoyed reading this book there were many parts that felt too much like a romance novel.  I caught myself rolling my eyes once or twice at the "fluffiness".  Enjoyable novel.

I purchased this book based on the large number of positive reviews.  I was so disappointed.  I cared so little about the characters that I didn't even finish the book.  It was placed on a shelf after I struggled night after night to read more, thinking that it would improve.  I was expecting something akin to Diana Gabaldon and this was no Outlander--just a pale imitation.  I felt the book was disjointed and  carelessly written.  It read a bit like two novels combined to fill pages.  I wouldn't recommend it.

I love reading historical fiction and Susanna Kearsley's stories are some of the best. THE WINTER SEA is by far my favorite Kearsley book. Ms. Kearsley researches thoroughly, doesn't alter historical facts to create a story and weaves a wonderful tale within past events (some authors trying to write historical fiction could learn a thing or two from her). Full of description about the places and settings, this book makes me want to visit Slains Castle in Scotland (something I hope to do soon). Thanks, Ms. Kearsley, for writing a wonderful book. I always look forward to the next one.

I had already read two other Susanna Kearsley books, Mariana and the Rose Garden, before The Winter Sea. I enjoy this author of historical romantic with a touch of mystical/paranormal books. I loved the Winter Sea! It had me sobbing at certain parts. You can tell that Ms. Kearsley does her research, the book is well written giving us the atmosphere without too many tedious details. This is part of a three-part "series" that are slightly linked together, but can be read separately. I suggest reading them in order - The Winter Sea, The Shadowy Horses and then The Firebird.

I really enjoyed this book.  As another reviewer wrote it is finely crafted throughout.  I have always been interested in the Jacobite period of Scottish history, and have read nonfiction books on the subject.  The author's excellent research and her knowledge of  key Jacobite figures enabled me to learn even more about this fascinating time in history.  Despite the historical accuracy, the plot was never dry, and kept me guessing until the end.  I have never read Susanna Kearsley before, but am happy to have discovered her writing and look forward to reading more of her books.

The relating of the historical facts in the story to Carrie's life today was an interesting way to read historical fiction. I generally read to be entertained and dislike excessive or confusing details in a story that I feel I need to refer back in the story to figure out what's going on. This happened to me a couple of times in this book,in part because I often have a number of days between reading and in part because I sometimes couldn't keep track of which Colonel's were on which sides. All that said, the story was entertaining and enlightening enough to keep me engaged.
I liked it but not as over the top wonderful as other reviews would indicate.

I think it was a great book and I enjoyed reading it as it went from modern day to the time of the Jacobites. There was one aspect of it that rubbed me really wrong-although the author was correct in her reason for doing it. I enjoyed that it was a romance, but it wasn't soppy and the heroes and heroines weren't unbelievable. They were nuanced and realistic and about more than a sappy romance. I love some history with my romance. I recommend it to those who appreciate carefully researched historical novels and authors who can really tell a story.

The connection between Carrie and Sophia was so much better than I expected; the pull of Sophia's situation was hard to resist.  Her hero, Moray, played off nicely against Graham, as well, with enough of a difference to render Graham interesting in his own right.  From the fullest, I was afraid I was in for another rendition of Outlander, but thankfully it was its own story.  I even was interested enough to do some browsing on the history of James and his attempts to reassert his right to the throne.  Looking forward to reading more of her work.

What a feat to write such an intricate storyline that flowed so easily. Author Carrie McClelland travels to Scotland and on her drive through Cruden Bay she has an intensive pull to Slains Castle. Unbeknownst to her, her ancestor "Sophia" was at this castle during the "Jacobite" years and her story begins flowing through Carrie. Carrie can see, feel and almost touch what Sophia lived. It was an interesting saga between current time and the early 1700's. What a great story that intertwines a part of lesser known history! Loved it

I really enjoyed this book.  It was more of a romance than I was expecting, but I actually enjoyed it as such, since the author leaves out the annoying junk you find in most "romance" novels.  She had me in tears more than once because you inevitably care deeply for the characters she creates.  I also learned a lot about Scotland's history I would have never known; sadly my previous knowledge began and ended with Braveheart....! I am currently reading another Susanna Kearsley novel because I liked this one so much.

Lyrical, elegiac, moving and beautiful. Beardsley writes with a measured cadence that is mesmerizing- you want to wrap yourself into the fiction, luxuriate in it, and let yourself be led this way and that. A snappy, fast paced chick lit this is not.  Historical fiction,  steeped with an aching windswept memory and the Jacobite cause makes you think deeply on those who gave their lives and fought and died for their king and country.  Lovely characters, thoughtful, soulful and well intentioned.  Highly recommend.

Susanna Kearsley is a master storyteller. She weaves just the right amount of history, romance and believable paranormal ideology to make a riveting story. She rivals Diana Gabaldon with her seamless transitioning between the present and the past. You are drawn into the story quickly with her choice of likable characters and her wonderful use of poetic descriptions of the landscape with which she centers her novel. A must read for everyone who enjoys getting lost in a fulling engrossing and believable story.

A beautiful historical romance, at times moody as the melancholy winter sea, but hopeful and alluring. Two parallel tales are woven, separated by 300 years but taking place in the same seaside Scottish hamlet. Beautiful romantic settings are painted, and historical events are treated with care and well-researched. Perfect for late winter/early spring reading when there's still a brisk chill in the air but you can feel the spring sun approaching. History buffs and romance fans will enjoy this novel.

This is one of the best books I've read in a while. It's full of history and I love learning new things from what I read. This is a book that you find yourself cheering for the characters and crying at their heartache. The author also delivered the story in  a neat way by providing the writers perspective as well so it's a dual storyline. The characters are deep and developed and the dialogue flows wonderfully. This is the first book I've read by Susanna Kearsley, but I can't wait to read another!

This was a beautifully well written book. Susanna Kearsley has an easy way of writing to where you can envision the characters as they develop gracefully. This is my first book of hers that I have read and I will be reading many more. I love historical fiction, but many novels can be cheesy with the romances. She made the lovers in this book seem real without all the fluff. I have to admit the last few chapters were well done and kept me very engaged. Honestly, I wish she would have kept on going.

I have a habit of reading alot of historical fiction..so much so that sometimes the books run together and you get a bit fatigued. This was not the case with "The Winter Sea". I appreciate how the author was able to jump from present day back to history and the return to continue the thread of the story. While the storyline is not perfect, it was entertaining and progressive. You didn't feel as though you needed to 'get through it'. It was a pleasure to read and really refreshing, in my opinion.

This book is a story about an author writing a book about Scottish historical fiction. I was a little confused at the beginning of this book, and concerned because I don't usually like historical fiction. But as I became more familiar with the storyline I started to get anxious to read the next installment of the Sophia/Moray saga.  She paints a vivid story and draws you into the book. I'm so happy to have found this, and look forward to reading more of her amazing stories.

I liked the book. There was a glimpse into period history and a good story to tell. A little predictable but the characterslocations are well developed and believable from the countess to the maid. Of course there is a love story, two in fact. Two stories of love one in 18th century and one present day in Scotland. The author tells an historical tale that unfolds from her subconscious past. Her research after the fact proves the authenticity of her "imagination ".

This book sat on my nightstand forever.  Put off by its big size, I held off reading until I could devote a satisfactory amount of time to it.  Not only was  it worth the wait, I was sorry that I waited so long.  Kearsley crafts a beautiful novel that switches time periods with ease.  Pages turneed swiftly, because I couldn't wait to see where we would be in the next chapter.  Vivd and likable characters, I will never put off another book by Susanna Kearsley ever again.

The Winter Sea is not normally a genre of book I would read - my taste usually goes to the exciting male dominated themes i.e. snipers, seals, military subjects - but I read a review of The Winter Sea on Amazon Books and it held me - the book is brilliant in story and the author's capability to move back and forth between her past story and present situation when writing the book - it's a moving love story, in both times, and great fun to read - kudoes to the author!!

Wonderful, from start to finish. I picked this book up at the library, I had never read Kearsley before--but will be purchasing it to own, it is one I will want to reread someday. The writing is great and the story and the history lesson  grab you from the start. I love how she effortlessly takes the reader from the past to the present. And the premise of genetic memory is intriguing - if only breaking through brick walls in family geneological research was that easy!

I enjoyed reading this historical fiction novel. I'm quite spoiled with Diana Gabaldon's Outlander series, but The Winter Sea held up pretty well in comparison.  One aspect i liked was learning more about a particular area and castle. I liked the characterization of the men in this book too, particularly the love interest Graham, and his father. The independent woman writer was a strange mix of strong and weak though...a bit hard for me to fathom all around.

Since finishing this book a couple of days ago I've been searching high and low for a book that is like either of the stories so graciously created in this novel. Contemporary or historic, I don't care. This book was so good I can't stop thinking about it. If you're a fan of Scottish history, or contemporary live stories with a twist, I strongly recommend it. Also. If anyone ever tells you this is just like Diana Gabaldon, tell them to suck it. It's not.

I truly enjoyed this book. With its' layered style, rich characters and settings, and deeply heart-felt emotion - I was a little sad to have it end. While a complex idea, the bounce back and forth through time/memories didn't interfere with the novels 'read-ability'. And Kearsley wraps it up nicely for both women - without making it too emotional or too flat. I think that's the thing with this whole book - the balance is spot on! I highly recommend it!

If you are a romantic, you will love this book.  Despite the many historical facts in the book, and I am not a history buff, it is so beautifully written that it all ties in for a magnificent and magical story.  The history did not bog down the story.  I turned around after my first read and started reading it again.  I am catching more of the history this time and remembering things better so it makes the story even more incredible.  Beautifully done.

When I finished this I was down because it was over and that doesn't happen too often to me anymore. If you love history and romance then you will love this...I loved how it ended but I wanted to keep reading about both romances going on in the story. It started off a little slow for me but I also have 2 young kids so I couldn't really sit too long reading before I had constant interuptions. I loved it and will be rereading it for sure.

This book had the makings of something that should have been good, but was incredibly boring. The historical aspects were like reading a textbook. No thanks. The author spent a great deal of time describing these boring historical moments. I generally love historical novels but I'm grateful that I borrowed this instead of paying for it. The characters were boring and had no chemistry.  I won't be reading anymore of her books.

I absolutely loved this book! I have recommended it to many who have read it and have also enjoyed it. I loved all the twists and turns in the plot and all the historical information. I loved the ending when you wonder if her male lover is related to someone in her research. Just a great read - a can't put the book down read. My only dislike was trying to read and understand the scotish dialect used by one of the characters.

This is a must read. It is written brilliantly. The flow of the two settings is so smooth it is easy to follow. The ending blew me away I was racing to get to the end of the book so I would know. I enjoy being shocked at the end of a book. This is truly a great piece of work and it was brilliantly put together. I  plan on reading more of her books as soon as possible. Thanks for the great read. I appreciate  a good writer.

I did enjoy this book. It doesn't grab you and stay with you for days like Diana Gabaldon's Outlander series...  HOWEVER the description said " But when she discovers her novel is more fact than fiction, Carrie wonders if she might be dealing with ancestral memory, making her the only living person who knows the truth-the ultimate betrayal-that happened all those years ago, and that knowledge comes very close to destroying her" ... I NEVER read about any "ultimate betrayal" and the heroine Carrie never "came close to being destroyed" I'm honestly not sure where such a description came from!!! I could go into more detail about parts of the book that bothered me but I don't want to list any spoilers for future readers. This is a good read on a rainy afternoon but don't expect a deep plot and fully developed characters.

I bought this book because it was one of those "if you liked XXX book, you might like..." and were they ever right! I loved this book. It has been a long time since I read something that drew me to read every spare minute. I have to admit, the historical accuracy is compelling but she made me cry with the reality and bare emotion so deftly captured here. Bravo to Ms. Kearsley, but also bravo to the programmers at amazon and the logic they put into this system for making such a brilliant recommendation. I am looking forward to looking at the next "if you liked The Winter Sea, then you might like..." with great anticipation.

This story is so much more than I expected. It drew me in and enthralled me. The author has written a truly exceptional work of art as well as historical fiction.  Susanna Kearsley wrote to enchant and envelop her readers and has definitely succeeded. I became wrapped up in Sophia and Carrie, their history and their separate lives and loves, from start to finish. I do not write spoiler reviews. This is a wonderful story.

...and also fans of Diana Gabaldon's Outlander series.  The Winter Sea is a must read for anyone as fascinated by the Stewart struggles as I am.  I appreciate her research and historical accuracy and found the story spell binding.  Like the fictitious author, Carrie McClelland, I had to remind myself that I had a real life ;).  Finished this in days as opposed to weeks that it normally takes me during a busy season.

One of the best finds I've gotten from amazon prime. I don't normally read historic fiction but this book was an interesting blend of modern storyline and history.  I'll admit sometimes I skimmed over some of the more detailed historic references but overall it was a strong storyline that compelled me to keep going.  The modern love story angle was a but predictable but the historic storyline compensated nicely.

Absolutely love love love this book and the one book that follows!!  If you love reading a CLEAN romance novel set in Scotland back in the Jacobite period then you will not be disappointed.  I did figure (or rather .... hope) what the ending might be and it just made me love the book even more. I have read almost all of the authors other books now bc I love the way she writes and hands down love her style.

I have yet to finish this book yet.  I am not going to write an elaborate review, but wanted to take a few moments to give this book a high rating.  I am 350 pages in and love how the author switches back and forth between present time and the past and how both tales intertwine.  Written with substance and romance, I am pleasantly surprised and never bored.  I imagine this book would make a great movie.

This was a nice change of pace from the usual historical romantic novel.  All that was there, but I enjoyed the rather obscure historical aspect of the authors research.  Also, there was a nice twist to the story to keep it interesting.  I did not see that coming.  I also liked the authors use of telling the story from two different time periods and the incorporation of the two.  Good read.

Based on the reviews I thought this was going to blow my mind, but it ended up just being pretty good. I did really like the modern day love interest, though. I think it's hard to write a romance and feature two stories equally. You end up telling two stories half as well. Also, *slight spoiler alert* as a parent, one major detail at the end did not sit right with me, or read as authentic.

I really enjoyed this book. Done from the point of view of the author as she is writing the book what is a  pretend author.  The book is about a author, Carrie, who is writing about a woman Sophia, set in Scotland in early 1700's. The story,  goes back and forth, between the author story and Sophia story. There are  some connection, between the two women.  which makes it very interesting.

I am in love with Dana Gabaldon's "Outlander" series and this book was recommended by other fans. It has the same sort of setting, one foot in the past and one in the present in Scotland. The author did a great job with the historical details, which can make or break a novel like this. I was charmed by both Carrie and Sophia! I will definitely be checking out more of Kearsley's work soon.

I have never read anything by Susanna Kearsley and found I enjoyed it very much. Kinda back and forth between past and present in a good way. Although along the lines of Garabalden (sp) "Outlander" it is different and has it's own good twists and storyline.  Loved the locale as well. Set in Scotland. The people were folks you would like and  I do indeed recommend this book.

I literally couldn't put this book down. True, I am a bit biased since it is set in one of my favorite periods of history, but the writing was beautiful and the characters leapt off the page. Kearsley blends the stories together perfectly and does a wonderful job of stirring emotions in the reader. I definitely 100% recommend this novel to anyone in need of a truly wonderful story.

As an avid fan of historical fiction, particularly the history of the Jacobites' ventures, this book was very satisfying. I was skeptical at first of jumping between first person and the novel being written by the first person character, but soon became accustomed to it and enjoyed the transitions from the past to the present very much. It truly gives you two love stories at once.

I'm not a book reviewer - I will say that this book made you love or even hate some of the characters. I found myself emotionally attached and wish that I could readily get my hands on this author's other books. I hope that she begins to publish books in the US. I'm going to read this book again, and again!

The story had a lot of potential, but there were issues I couldn't get past. There was so much secrecy in both romances, with no valid reason for all the lies and deception, especially in the modern day romance. That part didn't make sense, yet it was in integral part of the story. Had the story been implemented in a way that made more sense, it could've been brilliant.

Good Book, but I got a little weary of flipping back from present to book writing.  It felt like flipping from one channel to another and back again.  The ending was surprising and a nice wrap-up.  Not to give too much away; the main character's DNA memory was a little corny but I did enjoy the rich past and present Scotland history and sense of coziness of the cottage.

Wow!  This book had me rivited from the first page to the last.  I stayed up til all hours reading instead of sleeping.  When I finished I immediately went to the computer to find other books by this same author.  As a history major I really loved her true-to-life depictions and she answered some questions I'd had.  I'm looking forward to reading all of her books!

So many good reviews, I had it in my wish list for months.  The first bunch of pages was ok, I was interested enough but then as other one star reviewers have said, it just got really boring with nothing happening.  There are just too many good books out there that I can't wait to read to waste my time with below mediocre.  I really wanted to like it.  Sigh.

This was an unusual choice for me because at the time I thought it to be outside my usual preferred genre. While there were not any witches, vampires or werewolves in sight, I did very much get caught up in Carrie and Sophia's story.  I was even moved to tears at times which almost never  happens to me. I look forward to reading more from this author.
I really didn't want to put this wonderful historical novel down.Looking forward to reading more of her books.
Excellent story.

I have been reading several of this author's books and find the way she tells two stories in one...one from a historical past and one from the present...intriguing.  There is action, romance (but not explicit sex), and a plot that keeps one interested....good clean stories that take place in interesting places and times.
I absolutely love Susanna Kearsley's books.  Totally Awesome!!!  I have 1more book to read. I hope she writes many more books

This book draws you in from the very first page.  You enter the time period and live in Sophia's world, through her happiness and sorry.  Once you pick it up, it'll be hard to put it down.  Very well written.  And after you finish this one, pick up Firebird and start that one

A beautiful balance of historical fiction and romance. As the past and the present begin to weave together in a remarkable dance, it captivates the reader as they are drawn along on the journey of joy, loss, and hopes both deferred and realized. I thoroughly enjoyed reading this, and have already recommended it to several people.
Susanna Kearsley has a way of making the ridiculous notion of genetic memory seem perfectly possible.  Love the "remembered" love story almost more than the current one!

Susanna Kearsley delivers a well-researched story (her notes at the end are almost as enjoyable to read as the story) with beautiful prose and clever plot twists.  The author takes her time to develop relationships in a realistic and enjoyable way.

This historical fiction was so engrossing that I had a hard time putting it down. The last time I was this drawn in to a book of this genre, it was a dragonfly in Amber . And margarete Georges book about Cleopatra.
This is a page turner and a book with two stories that intertwine very cleverly  together.  You will be glad that you read this book.  It makes me beg for a sequel!
Easy read.  I had a hard time putting it down.  I will definitely look for other books by this author.
Rich story telling carries you while you enjoy history and present day Scotland both in a delightful romance.  Love the characters.
As a complement to The Firebird, this was an excellent journey through Scottish history and a love story well told.

This is the first of Susanna Kearsley's books I have read, but it won't be the last.  I have always wondered, and been amazed by, how an author can create characters and make them  seem so real.  By making her author in the book a descendant of the character she's writing about, somehow the possibility of some kind of DNA memory makes sense.  A thoroughly engrossing story which moves seamlessly between the present and the distant past and yet keeps historical people and places factual; bringing them to life in a wholly believable way.  I loved every minute of it and can't wait to read the next one!

I ended up really liking this book. I wasn't so sure about it when I started reading it because the beginning was kinda slow. But I fell in love with all the characters. Story ended up folding really nicely. I'm giving it 4 stars, because it wasn't one of those books you just can't out down, but I'm pretty sure I'll read it again in the future because I did like it a lot.

I love history and am just learning about my own Scottish roots.  The fictional story about a present day author Traveling to Scotland to research the actual  1708 failed invasion Of King James, a Catholic, on the coast of northeast Scotland, writing about that event and then weaving two beautiful love stories into the plot just kept me riveted to this book.  I can not wait to pick up another Susanna Kearsley book!

I love the way that the author writes historical fact and mixes  it with fiction.  Her stories are interesting, filled with likable characters. and her descriptions of the landscape are very believable.  It makes me want to visit the destinations that she describes.  She reminds me of Ciji Ware, another female author who writes historical fiction.
If you enjoyed the Outlander series you will definitely like this book.  Once you begin this book you won't want to put it down until you come to the end.  Enjoy.
I loved the book. It had everything and the ending was spectacular!  I would definitely recommend this book to anyone who loves history ,
This book has a beautiful story line, very tender and compassionate.  I loved every page and the ending was perfect.  Karen B.

This was one of the best books I have read. It is two books in one. Loved the ancestral history of the main character, who is an author writing a book about her ancestors, and how that story affects her life. Highly recommend this book to all who like to read historical fiction. Want to read more by this author.
Very different approach loved the characters. I hope the author writes another book continuing this with a series. Time travel inspiration.
Susanna Kearsley is a wonderful writer. She gets all of the nuances.  I would love to read more of her books.
I made Moray look like Gerard Butler in my mind of course! Beautiful scenery! Loved every bit of the story!
Kearsley does a wonderful job of intertwining the simultaneous stories in the book.  The characters were likeable an  th  choices some had to make were heartbreaking, but believable.
This is the first Kearsley book I have read.  I enjoyed it immensely.  The blend of modern day and historical time was very well done.

I normally don't read romance but I enjoy books that are historical and have an element of time travel in them. I loved the main female character and how the contemporary and historical stories were intertwined. The historical part of the story was almost completely based on real events and when I would stop reading I would immediately get online and try to get more information about what had happened because it was so interesting. The ending was a surprise and I actually found myself getting misty-eyed - very unusual for me! A great read and easy to get into

This was my first experience reading a Susanna Kearsley book.  I was intrigued as two interwoven stories meshed into one.  I immediately searched for another book by this author.  Love her attention to scene description to immerse the reader in the story.

Enjoyed the mix of the author's present-day life and the happenings in the material she was writing.  Do enjoy learning about that period, tho the polifical intrigue became confusing at timesa.  Exciting neverthelesasa!
I love all of Susanna Kearsley's books. Very intriguing. Keeps you interested until the last word. I highly recommend this book.

Not often does a book leave me so emotional. I was taken on a romantic journey back in history. I laughed, I cried, I felt like I was also living in this great castle by the sea. Not only was there romance but there was a strong plot both in present day and the past which left me highly satisfied. I will no doubt be reading more novels by Susanna Kearsley.
Very engaging writer and a good storyline. I enjoyed this book very much and would like to read more of her books as she is a new author find for me.

I glanced at the one star reviews and wondered what it would take for these readers to like a book.  This book is so far above most others that it puts them to shame.  The juxtaposition of a modern story with a historical one is not typically one I like, but it works here.  I'm so glad I read this book and, based on how much I enjoyed it, I will also read the author's other books.

Ms. Kearsley writes a very different type of book with every book she writes. Each time there is a totally riveting historical plot.  The Winter Sea is about an author, Carrie. Carrie’s characters talk to her as she writes their story.  She becomes aware that she might be related to these people. This is an almost impossible idea to her.  However, the more she writes, the more she questions this theory. The story takes place in Scotland at the character’s family castle.  She moves to the area for the ambiance to help her write the story.  She has unbelievable feelings of her surroundings during her stay.  Her father keeps her grounded until he begins to wonder about her knowledge prior to his finding it in his research. This is a story takes place during the 1700s. Ms. Kearsley’s descriptions are so real you feel the place and see what she sees through her eyes. Her research shows her talent for making it all work into a fantastic mystery.
This author always pulls me into the story..  I like the history and obvious research that goes into her books. I would highly recommend

What a delightful book to read. I especially enjoyed the way it was written.  You are reading a book within a book along with getting your snippets of history.  Very entertaining.  I could of read more!  The ending was a nice surprise.
A romantic and haunting story.  Blending past and present together beautifully.  A very sweet romance.  This is a very captivating book.
I love this book.  It was one of those books I wish would never end.  The perfect blend of historical fiction and life.

This is the first book I read from Susanna Kearsley and I can say it won't be my last.  I loved both stories, past and present, and couldn't put it down at times....I even shed some tears.  There was enough history to keep me involved in plot but not so much that I felt I was talking a history class.  The way it was written from past to present was really done well and I was so interested in both lives that I didn't mind going back and forth.  Looking forward to reading more from her!
This is one of the best books I have read in a long time.  It jumps between the present time and many years ago.  It will keep you up at night!!!

I have read 3 of Susanna Kearsley's works, and this was my favorite.  I liked the interplay between the characters in the present, as well as how their story mimicked those of the characters of the past.  She held my interest the whole way through, and I especially loved her ending twist.  Great author!  Can't wait to explore more of her works.
This was a wonderful book, mostly if you are drawn to historical fiction. It has war, romance, intrigue, and suspense. All and all, I couldn't put it down!
It was great reading about so many of the places I've been in Scotland.  This was very well written and a very unique story line.

Susanna Kearsley mastered the voice of this time period... I was transported by her rich detail and vivid storytelling. She weaved the past and the present seamlessly to where I could not put this book down. I highly recommend this book for a winter's read by a warm fire!
Everytime I thought I knew what was going to happen she had my mind changed. There were enough details to place yourself there but so many that you get bored. Loved it.
Thoroughly enjoyed this book. It kept my interest with two good story lines and interesting characters. Great ending. This is her second book I have read. Looking forward to reading all the others

This is the first book by Susanna Kearsley that I have read.  I immediately loved her style of writing and subject matter.  I am looking forward to reading every one of her books.  Thanks for a great read.

I have been reading Susanna Kearsley novels for the last several months, unfortunately out of order.  So I am finding out deteils in The Winter Sea about characters I fell in love with in Firebird.  I love that about her books.  She brings all thngs full circle.  She weaves real places and history into the story line.  It allowed me to find the locations and some of the historical characters on the Internet so I could "see" what her characters were seeing.  I realize that adds a level of complication to the writing and appreciate the effort she makes to do so.  I recommend reading her books in order although, as I have found, it is not necessary to enjoying her books.
Well written historical romance.  I loved the  book and the characters. The Scottish brogue was fun to learn. Read it.

This book is never boring or confusing and a steady read. I like the blending of the historical, the fiction, and the modern story. Even if you aren't a sucker for a happy ending (like I am) you will at the very least learn something.
This story draws you in instantly! The scenes are and characters are visible through the beautiful narration! I could hardly put it down!
Susanna Kearsley has become one of my favorite authors. Her narrative voice keeps you interested and wanting the story to continue. I look forward to more of her writings.

This is the third of Kearsley's novels that I've read and it's my favorite so far. I enjoyed going back and forth between past and present and discovering Sophia's story along with Carrie. There was one bit, however, that it think was left hanging — quite a lot of mention was made of the evil presence that Carrie felt outside of her cottage but nothing was expressly resolved, although I think it may have been the spirit of Billy Wick. I really enjoyed this novel and have been recommending it to my friends.

I fell for the characters, both the current time and the historical, and was so impressed at the way this author moved back and forth seamlessly between them.  Also loved the completion of events that fit perfectly with the actual history of that place, and the ending for the main characters. Very clever!  I will read more from this author as I really like her style.

I found Susanna Kearsley's book on a Kindle book deal and what a find. I was drawn into her characters almost immediately and could hardly put the book down. Through Kearsley's words I felt like I truly knew her characters and could visualize the settings where the story unfolded. Truly a gifted writer and one I will choose to read again!

Great writer.  Wonderful story.  I love Scottish history / time travels / romance all in one.  Have already purchased and look forward to reading more books by Susanna Kearsley.  Highly recommend this book.
Character development is good. Good story line intertwined with characters story. Perfect length, not too short and not too long.

Since reading Winter Sea, I have become a huge Susanna Kearsley fan! Her seamless weaving of past to present, the depth of her characters and the level of historical research engage me in much the same way Diana Gabaldon's work does. Of all her books (after having read Winter Sea I have scarfed down almost all her books), Winter Sea will remain my favorite for its beauty of storytelling.
This book was hard for me to get into at first, but I kept reading and found myself interested.  Not my normal kind of reading, but I would recommend it to those who like a good historic romance.

I am so excited to find another with the talent and imagination that equals Sarah Donato and Diana Gabaldon. I am a devotee of them and have now added Me. Kearsley to my list of must reads.  She combines history with fiction and romance and transits between centuries with exceptional grace.

This historical fiction was a fun, interesting reading experience. I enjoyed following both stories, past and present, and was fascinated by the concept of genetic memory. At times, the details of historical events/people read a bit like a history text, with numerous minor characters to keep track of, but overall, the plotline was interesting to follow. I especially loved the surprising twist at the end...

I found myself completely engaged in this story that  craftily spins a parallel tale in both historical and modern day Scotland.  The juxtaposition of the two times is not only cleverly done, but the writing flows beautifully and the characters  (and times) come alive.  I couldn't wait to get back to reading to experience the beauty of the locations, the relationship of the characters and to  see how it would all come together.  I hope you will enjoy the story as much as I did.

If you love Scotland, genealogy and love stories, you will find this to be the perfect book for you. It gives a very detailed history that may serve as a bit of a prequel to the history covered in Diana Gabaldon' s book Outlander. The dual and interconnected love stories were done well. Highly recommended.

Winter Sea has to be one of the best books I've read in awhile...historically correct..it's a look back at Scotland in the 17th century, the fight for freedom..for love ..for family..and for land..  The way it's written had me hooked from the beginning. .being written in the 20th century but taken back to live the life of her characters...truly fascinating..I look forward to reading anything done by Susanna Kearsley, hoping there just might be a sequel to Winter Sea...

I couldn't stop smiling after finishing this book. It's as though, because she loves her readers and wants them to be happy, Kearsley decided to give us, not only a happy ending with Sophia, but a really great twist on the family of her modern-day main character's love interest. Real, raw emotions could be felt throughout the story and I found myself truly caring about the characters. Even if you read this and its sequel (kind of) out of order like I did, the story is equally fulfilling because you see how characters' relationship s develop and you know the later days of main characters and can thus be gifted with both anticipation and surprise at the outcome. I'm geeking out a bit here! Onto the next Kearsley book!
Awesome book, a little slow at times but as a Scottish history major, it was brilliantly written.  I enjoyed every page.

Another great love story but maybe a little too heavy on the history this time. I found my myself 'skimming' thru pages that felt like they were getting bogged down in Jacobite and war history. Love John and Sophia, though!
I loved every word. I felt like I was living the history and could not wait to read what happened next. Excellent retelling of history. I cannot wait to read another by Ms. Kearsley.

I was surprised  by how quickly I was drawn in to this story. Being a writer myself, I feel I was incredibly drawn to Carrie and the details of her writing process. I would recommend this story to my friends and look forward to more by this author.

I totally enjoyed Winter Sea.  Love the way she bring little pieces of her other books into it; other people you recognize and even the Sentinel from Shadowy Horses.  Very interesting historical knowledge, I have found a new author to enjoy a bit like Maeve Bienchy.  Have recommended to my friends.

This is the second book by Susanna Kearsley I've read and she is definitely now a favorite. I'm glad there are more books by her to read. The characters were easy to become attached to, the dual storylines both kept my interest. You know it's a good read when you find yourself thinking of the characters and missing them when the book ends!
I love historical romance novels and this is one of the best! Don't pass up a chance to read this one.
Yet another wonderful story written by Susanna Kearsley.  She manages to weave quite the story (and also manages to incorporate characters from her other books in roundabout ways).

This book was great--history (battle of 1708 with the Jacobites trying to restore the Stewart King James to the Scottish throne after the English created the Union), parallel romances (one in modern day with the author doing research for her new book, and one set in the past), loss and triumph. I loved the historical characters--John Moray, The Countess of Errol, Sophia, Captain Gordon, and others. I also loved the main characters love of family history and how she solves her own family mystery unexpectedly. The author's notes at the end about her research were very interesting to me.

And read this book almost without stopping. I enjoy historical fiction and also enjoyed the interweaving of the two lives regardless of the fanciful nature of this particular approach. But who know what memories we carry and I have experienced enough deja vu to suspend disbelief for a good yarn. I recommend this book and will read more by this author.
I enjoyed this book immensely. It was well written and historically interesting. The dual story line made it a fun read.

This book held my interest from the first paragraph.  Susanna Kearsley is a terrific author.  So many historical incidents and characters are present and I almost felt like I was really there.  Great book!
great from plot and characters beginning to end. I couldn't stop reading. I loved Carrie's and Sophia's stories and couldn't wait to see how each would end.
I already love historical romance, and this has a slight paranormal twist. Greatly enjoyed this book and others by Kearsley.
once I picked it up, I couldn't help but feel compelled to read it cover to cover, almost without putting it down.
This book proved to be a pleasant diversion from my typical reads. Looks like I may have another favorite author to draw from...
Well worth the read! Captivating from the start, intriguing, heart wrenching, and with a deliciously twisted finale. I couldn't put it down!
Modern day and historical stories both well developed.  Great blending of the two threads and very satisfying conclusion to both tales.

Though it did, for me, get a little bogged down in it's history lessons, the last few chapters more than made up for any boredom on my part.  I sobbed, and if a book can move me to that, it is worth a read and will always be with me.

Breathtaking. Beautifully written, with details and characters that truly come to life. The first book by Susanna Kearsley that I have had the pleasure of reading, but it certainly won't be the last. An interesting twist on an old formula and one that I couldn't put down. Fans of historical fiction will be pleased!
Read it in two nights. It was easy to fall into the worlds of the characters, both modern and historic.

This book was quite the surprise. I did not expect the supernatural aspect but Kearsley pulls it off amazingly well. The story feels haunting and moody just like Scotland where it takes place. I really recommend this book to fans of historical fiction.
hard to put down... the story goes back and forth seamlessly between time and characters. not a time travel novel but unique!
I liked the romance, the strong women portrayed in this book, the suspense and drama - all of it! The the past and in current time! I would definitely recommend this book!

What a lovely book to read by firelight, well any light really.  I thoroughly enjoyed the characters, especially the main characters.  I much appreciated the effort by the author to portray them in an accurately historical light.  I'm excited to begin my next book by the author!
I don't usually read fiction, but this book is very well-written  and held my interest.  The characters are believable, and the plot is interesting.
The book is good, not great.  I had a hard time keeping up with all the characters.  This was a book chosen for our book club.
Well written, a bit predictable, but told well enough that i never wanted to stop reading.  This is the first book I have read by her, and will definitely be checking others out.
Probably the best book I ever read, made me feel good in body and soul. I've recommended this book to several of my friends.

Rich in history and a heart string pulling romance. This story was near perfection. I would have liked to read more about the present day love affair and how the connection of the two ancestral women came about. However, it was a fascinating read.
A friend recommended this book and I'm really glad I listened. This was a very enjoyable read along the lines of Diana Gabaldon's Outlander series.
Really well done!  Ms. Kearsley is an excellent writer, creating great characters in a convincing setting.  Liked it very much.
Susanna Kearsley is a very good story teller and seems to have the ability to hold your interest and want to NOT put it down.
This book was so awesome.  I hated that it had to end.  I loved all the history and the love story was beautiful.
We did this book with my book club and most everyone liked the history and ancestor info and the characters.  I also enjoyed the Scottish area scene.
I like this author. This book was mystical, and a tad romantic-nicely written, though a bit dry at times. I will read more of her work.

I loved the way the book is written with a story within a story.  The author kept me engrossed in both life of the storyteller and the historical story.  She makes history come alive as she lives the life of her characters.  I would recommend this book to anyone who enjoys historical fiction.
I like reading about history and romance. This is about a castle on a cliff on the Scottish sea, and is a good read.
I truly enjoyed this story greatly.  I loved how Kearsley mixed present day with the past.  Truly a well told story and a great read.
I can't help it, I really liked this book. I love Scotland and I loved this book. I love the characters and the castles.

I loved this book - a well written, compelling story with fantastic character development!  It had a great mix of history and romance.  Ms. Kearsley writes beautifully and I felt transported to Scotland in the early 1700s.  I rarely re-read a book but I am looking forward to reading this one again.  Highly recommended.
I really enjoyed this book and have started reading another by this author. I thought the storyline was different and interesting.
Susanna Kearsley puts me right in the middle of every one of her stories. I can experience every one of her characters' emotions and I love the way she writes about people falling in love.
Very good read..I did not want to put it down...Have been reading all she writes... Awesome!!! Takes you away in time...
A love story that I could not see all the twist and turns coming. Susanna Kearsley  painted history and characters vividly with such depth I did not want to stop reading!

The Winter Sea is one of the most enjoyable history lessons I've had the pleasure of reading. Susanna Kearsley is a gifted story teller that uses many actual events and persons to weave an engaging story of love, loss and perseverance. When I read a good historical fiction it always makes me wonder why the subject at school was usually so very dry and dull. Fans of The Outlander series will enjoy a similar style of writing and character development. I will be looking forward to more of Ms. Kearsley's work.
Lost causes, love lost then found, a stroll through genealogical history... Who could ask for more? All in all, a good read.

Creatively written, intertwining the author with historical character.  Also bought the Audible audio book that accompanied it, and enjoyed the reader's Scottish accent to enriched the text.  A good entertaining read.

This was Avery good read.  I got so involved in the story, I cried when Sophia lost John and when she left her child I was crying so hard I had to put my kindle down and walk away.  I was so glad John made it back to her.  I will always wonder if she ever saw her Anna again.  I recommend this book highly.  It is a wonderfully compelling story.  Thanks go to the author Me Kearsley  for her efforts.  NoraMoore

An adventurous, thrilling, heartbreaking, but absolutely beautiful love story! A definite page turner that will grip you and not let go till it's done. This book made me laugh out loud and smile, toward the end, had me balling like a little baby! The story within a story was a great idea. I absolutely loved it & cannot wait to start on another Susanna Kearsley book!
Interesting book! Love the history and method of writing. It had me looking things up about the historical characters and time period

This is a book I could read over and over without getting bored. It is well written with the characters intermingled.  The historical accuracy of the time period never faltered throughout the story. Much more than just a time travel
The plot of the book is captivating with going from current time, back to historical medieval Schotland.  The twists and turns of the plot intertwined with historical facts, makes it a great read.

I could not put this book down once I began reading it. The characters came to life and when I had to put the book down I was continually thinking of the characters. Would recommend this book and would read it again. Perfect book to grab a cup a tea and settle into your favorite chair to read! Loved it!
A deeply engaging read for those who like a bit of fact mixed with their fiction . Wonderful character development.

A truly captivating read from beginning to end. I loved, laughed, cried, (got steamy) through my journey with her and didn't want it to end. Made my friends read it, and they all hugged me hard. Thank you for gifting us w your talent.
I have enjoyed all of Gabaldon's works,  and I couldn't wait to turn page after page of Winter Sea, thank you !!

Good story, loved the history of the place & time borne out by vivid characters.  I personally did not care for the jumping between the historical and the present day. I found myself skimming ahead to get to the next historical action. I really appreciated how the love story was skillfully portrayed without detailing every body part!
it was oringianl and  enjoyable. the setting was great but I got so tired of the historical part. my family loved it.
I really enjoyed this book. I Don't want to give anything away. It's a must read and I want to nominate it for the November book club!

I didn't quite know what l thought of this book at first, but l learned quickly that l  was completely caught up in this wonderful history lesson.  Susanna Kearsley is an excellent writer, and l look forward to reading her other books.  Thank you very much.  McEwen
This was an interesting story.  The characters were well developed and the plot was good.  Sometimes it took a little concentration to keep up with the switch between the present and the past.

I liked this one better than Mariana, because of all the historical insight and research. More meat for someone who wants to learn new items about the past while enjoying a novel. Kearsley's characters are well drawn and the details of the period seem realistic.

I love historical novels, and I'd heard a lot of good things about this author. I know the book is popular, so I am surprised that I kept putting it down and not feeling inclined to pick it up again (I did, of course, but without great enthusiasm).  I did like the main characters, the setting, and the general plot, but I guess I found the contemporary heroine's "genetic memory" of the events of the past rather unconvincing. I usually enjoy psychic or paranormal elements, but this felt a little too heavy-handed to me. I do intend to read her other novels, though, since I was impressed with her writing and her historical research.
As always, Susanna Kearsley writes a magnificent story! This book is absolutely wonderful! I'm just sad that I'm finished reading it! Awesome reading!

This was a great book to get lost in. Susanna Kearsley keeps you in the present, but also transports you back to the early 1700's for a tale of romance and war. It was easy to get swept up in her beautiful writing of the landscape and the characters. Can't wait to read more from her!
For some very light reading I enjoyed this book.I was disappointed at how shallow the story was and kept thinking it would get better.Not anywhere near Diana Gabaldon.
Couldn't put this down, what an inspiring, wonderful journey.  A very satisfying uniting of a writer's characters and her ancestry.
More history that I never knew before. I liked the historical story better than the modern story. Hadn't thought of the ending.

This is the first novel that I could hardly put down, and even though I guessed some of what would happen, it was the first story to cause me to cry.  I cried twice while reading it which truly shows how real and engaging the story was.  I also enjoyed the story within the story. It is a novel that could be read and enjoyed by all.

If you love historical fiction, look no farther than Susanna Kearsley.  Her painstaking accuracy lends credence to a brilliant love story.  I was surprised at how real the characters became.  Absolutely loved it and will definitely be reading more.

Great and imaginative story.  Loved the historical aspect of the plot.  This was my first delve into the author and I will keep reading her stuff as long as they live up this one.  No swearing, no graphic sex, just a great story.
LOVED the dual plots and all the characters to bring the story to life. I'm looking forward to other books by this author.
I loved this book.  Well written, lots of history intertwined with a love story.  In a different league than books in the usual historical romance genre.

I loved this book. From the beginning it grabs your attention. I loved how effortlessly the author told the modern day story and the past story with seamless transitions. It was fun enjoying new history while getting caught up in two beautiful romances.
Outstanding. Well written. Unlike most historical fictions, this book is suspensful, intriguing, and romantic. I have recommended it to several people and will continue to recommend it.

Thoroughly enjoyed Winter Sea, my first reading of Susanna Kearsley. Loved her descriptive scenery, how she straddled two worlds/time periods, and all the Scottish minutia. I especially connected with her use of 'the doric' accent, as this is how my grandparent's spoke. They were from the same region in Scotland. So many of Kearsley's references took me back to my childhood memories - even the foods she described. My aunties fixed our family oatcakes, scones and shorties. I've always enjoyed the blending of history, a bit of romance, and a wee bit of the mystical.

I'm sorry to say that I did not, could not, finish this book. The writing was fine; it was the plot and characterization. Neither went anywhere. I got more than half way through and had to put it down out of frustration. Too many academic style lectures, too much unnecessary detail, not enough character development and a whole lot of waiting for someone, anyone, to do something. I like female characters to have a spine and an opinion. I'm sorry, this was not a book for me.

Enjoyed very much!  Anyone who appreciates history with real as well as imagined characters so vibrant you find it hard to imagine they are fictitious, so vividly drawn, and geography so breathtakingly real will relish reading Winter Sea!
Perfect blend of history and fiction. I will be reading more of Ms Kearsleys books in the very near future.
I figured out the ending early on but had to make sure it truly would happen. Great story within a story. Love the historic referencing and the play of characters. Fantastic writing!
This was a fascinating book! I loved the rich history, and the lovely characters. I could not put this down!
I absolutely loved this book. I could hardly put it down- and when I did, I could hardly wait to pick it back up. I loved the writing style, the characters, everything.

Loved the interweaving of real historic facts and a writers perspective around 2 stories within one book. It was hard to put down and I frequently didn't get much sleep because of this beautiful book.

I normally don't reread books. I first read this book about three years ago and thought about it and had to read it again. I read alot but this is by far my favorite. It captures you and has you there even if you want to stop reading you can't. I would recommend this book to anyone and everyone. Thank you for this master piece.
Historical fiction blended with modern and romance in both time periods. Perfect. It makes you wonder, is there really genetic memory? Is that the source of deja vu?
I really enjoyed this book. This is the first piece of historical fiction I've read in years that was done incredibly well. Couldn't put it down. Well done!
Like many other reviewers I could not put the book down because her story drew me in and kept me enticed till the end.
This was a great book!  It was very hard to put down.  I cannot wait to read some more from Susanna Kearsley.
Absolutely Beautiful and haunting story. I was captured from page one and addicted until the end. Even when the story was over I was still wrapped up in this world. Beautiful and descriptive writing.
Not a huge fan of historicals, but whenever I hear about a new Kearsley, I run out to get it. The Winter Sea is a mystery, a history, and a romance, and a wonderful read.
Yes, my heart was aching all through this story, with vivid descriptions, realistic dialogue. and not knowing for sure where the story was going.

A friend of mine suggested Susanna Kearsley's books.  I started with Mariana, which I loved, but Winter Sea was such a wonderful adventure I didn't want the book to end.  I plan to read it again ... perhaps in the winter, if I can hold off that long!  Loved the characters so much I wished they were real.  What a beautiful escape.  Highly recommend.

This was a truly fascinating story, an exciting adventure, and a wonderful, heartwarming, romance. I actually put aside another book I was reading to delve into and finish this. If all of history were told this way, I would have been a much better student. I highly recommend this book, even over the others I've read by the same author. And I have loved them all so far.
A good story, with parallel plot lines in two different centuries.  I liked the way the story was structured.  The two concurrent plot lines were both equally engrossing.

Time travel, Scotland, romance...what more could you ask for? This book is extremely well written, not a dull spot to make you want to put it down, EVER, and has engaging characters and plot! I can't wait to read more by Ms. Kearsley!
Susanna is an awesome, spellbinding author.  She is one of those authors that I trust and automatically buy their books without reading the reviews and I have never been disappointed!!!
Great author, good descriptions, great dialoge.  Very suspenseful.  Kept my interest.  Love how she weaved history into her novel.  Good Read.

I got Firebird first but after reading the reviews for it and that she had written Winter Sea I knew I wanted to read this one first. I'm glad I did. This story kept me guessing, hard to put down, now I get to read another of her books!
Truthfully, I had a hard time getting into this for the first few chapters.  Lots of background history was required to move the story forward, so patience is important.  But, it was well worth it.
Amazing book! It didn't get NY Times best seller for nothing. Great for anyone looking for an adventurous and character capturing book. Though named Winter Sea this was a great summer read.
It had promise, but for me, contained too many historical details. I like to feel the ambience of a different period, but when there are too many details and facts, it robs the story.
Super reading, fun, romantic, and interesting!  After reading "Shadowy Horses," and a few others, had to pick this one up, too!, I have become a true fan of Susanna Kearsley!

Winter Sea is my kind of book....chock full of real historical facts with a "fictional story" woven in amongst them.  I am missing being at Slains with Sophia and the Countess of Erroll.  Truly loved this book.

Thoroughly enjoyable read. Filled with suspense, wonderful romance, and accurate, riveting history. The author skillfully  wove a tapestry of fiction and real events  to bring us a novel I couldn't put down.

Winter Sea is excellently researched. history, poignant romance, and fascinating  time travel all in one.  SUSANNA  KEARSLEY  is an accompli.shed author, character builder and plot spinners well.  My previous  knowledge of the Jacobiteswas only about  Bonnie Prince Charlie, and I was fascinated by the complexities of previous generations of Stewart symphathisers.  I will lock for more on this subject,and I will certainly look for more books by Susanna KEARSLEY!
I love the double story line in this book and how they are intricately intertwined into a beautiful historical tale. I look forward to reading more from Kersley.
Ms Kearsley pulls you into her world so completely that you can feel her sun on your face and her wind in your hair. Well written!
Another great mix of history, adventure, and love. Kearsley is s becoming a favorite  of mine. Once you start you won't want  to pit this book down.

It's a fast and fun read and I learned a little about Scottish history in the process.  At first when the author introduced the "2nd" story I was a little annoyed until I became aware of the continuity between the main character and the background story... Then I couldn't put it down! I would definitely recommend it!

A well-drawn cast of characters pulled, for the most part, from history, calls to into the Scottish past, while dueling with Scotland's present. Of intrigue, passion and strength, a delightful tale that you don't want to end.
This story is well done and the history is accurate which I always enjoy. The details are well written. Enjoy !
There are two stories in one. Be sure to read Firebird after The Winter Sea.  I lost much sleep due to my interest in both these books.
Excellent story, well written.  True to the history.  I did not want the story to end.  Look forward to her next book.

I've read a number of historical novels set during the time of James' exile in France, but this was the most enjoyable and well researched. You care about the characters and find yourself caught up in the intrigue.
Good thing this book is over 500 pages because you don' t want it to end, she writes so well.

I enjoy time travel historical fiction immensely and  Winter Sea was the first book I've read by this author. The format was quite different then previous time travel books I have read so at first I was worried, but after reading the first few chapters I really began to enjoy it! And without giving away any of the story, I have to say I'm so glad her "editor had her make some changes". I cried, I fell in love and I learned a lot!! Susanna Kearsley has definitely been added to my "favorite" authors list! I hope you fall in love with all the different characters as I did. I can't wait to read her next one!!
I was a big fan of the Outlander and Wilderness series and I found this pretty entertaining, as well. Good read. It's also refreshing to read one book! :)
Really good book. I read it in a few days. Love how the author is so clean....no cussing and no sex scenes.  :-)
This book peaked my interest in Scotland history.  I liked how she actually felt the places and people she was writing about.

Winter sea was an entertaining story bringing in Scottish history to the modern day setting.  I had a hard time getting into the characters, but they did grab my interest.  The stories were interesting and entertaining and the ending did not disappoint.

This book was fast paced and I liked how it switched from present day to historical times when the narrator of the book was "taken" over by the need to write an event for her book that she was writing.

This was by far the best historical romance I have ever read.  I loved the dual stories as it kept me wanting to read more and more.  I was touched by each of the characters and loved the interesting intertwinings of them as the story developed. I also loved the history lesson I got while reading.  There was a good bit of real history in this book that made it that much more fun to read -- it wasn't just silly descriptions of dresses and balls.  I also loved that it wasn't too long.  I find Diana Gabaldon a little too long to keep me interested.  This book was touching and inspiring. I highly recommend it.

As some of the other reviewers mentioned, the book is slowly paced.  I'm not entirely sure how else the author could have given the history behind the setting, the characters, the politics of the times, etc.  Both stories draw you in, and by the end, you are hoping that both stories end happily.  No spoilers here.  It's a must read for anyone who loves historical fictions!

The Winter Sea pulled me into a world where genetics was given credit for whom we really are rather than believing that man is an island.  We are the essence of our ancestors with a life we all must treasure and wear with pride.
This was the first Susanna Kearsley  novel I have read and I found it fairly good once I warmed up to it. The writing is decent and the two stories held my attention.
This is the best book that I have read in a long time and have recommended  it to a friend.

I thought this was a well written historical fiction story within a story.  2 love stories for the price of one, running parallel to each other as the author unfolds the details of how England eventually conquers Scotland to become the United Kingdom.  Couldn't put it down.  Loved it.

Great story. I loved the way it went back and forth between the present and the past. I would get so caught up in one era that I would totally forget there were two intertwining stories going on. The author did her research. It was a wonderful, romantic, historical fiction.  Highly recommended!!
I hated that it ever ended.  so much history in a really good story.  I did like the ending, even though I would have liked to keep reading.

The sensation of intertwining lives lends this novel a rich texture.  Two reads in one - the multiple layers allow us to leave all non-essentials of each plot by the wayside to focus on the best moments of each story.  Style and execution make this an excellent choice for readers who relish diversity.  The juxtaposition of past and present drew me more intimately into the past than most stories can.  Enjoy!

This is one book that I could read over and over again and not get tired of it.  It is so easy to get caught up in it and lose track of time.  It's very descriptive of both the present and past events and that makes it easy to follow the story line.  It is such a wonderful story all the way around.  I really felt for Sophia and Moray the whole time whenever they were the main focus.  I would whole-heartedly recommend this book to anyone looking for a wonderful romance book that has a little touch of history in it.  I will warn you, there is a good chance towards the end you may cry, so have some tissues handy.

I can't remember the last time a book brought me to tears - both sad tears and tears of joy.  This book did.  I got so caught up in the story.
