Well, both stories, actually, that were intertwined expertly.  The ending took me delightfully by surprise.  Since there are so many other reviews that give a synopsis of the story, I won't do that here.  I'll just say "Read this book!"  Well written, well-developed characters that you will come to care about, beautiful settings, history, suspense... it's all here.  A wonderful story.  One that I'll be thinking about for a long time.  I'll definitely be reading more from this author!

I do not read romance novels, ever, But when I began reading Susanna Kearsley's novels and discovered some romance I didn't mind at all.  I consider these novels, I am on my fourth now, to be mystery, science and fantasy all rolled up in one.  I also enjoyed the descriptions of the tiny town and the people therein who are so a part of the sea. I would reccommend this and any of Kearsley's book to everyone.
I chose the book because it was a selection for my book club. I enjoyed the way it was written and found both stories very interesting.
As other reviews noted, it grabs you from the start and moves seamlessly between the past and the present.  I will read more of her books.
Amazing combination of two women's stories in one.  I did not want to put down this cleverly written book.  Kudos to Ms. Kearsley!
Kearsley was a new author for me, but I will be reading more of her books! I loved the story.

The first book I read of Kearsley's was The Rose Garden, which I loved.  I didn't think her other books could be as good, so was actually slow to read The Winter Sea.  However, my neighbor said it was one of her favorites, so I skeptically began to read it.  What a surprise!  I LOVED this book, could not put it down.  Such an incredible emotional ride!  I can't decide now which is my favorite!  I love the unexpected plot development and twists and turns.  Just could not put it down.  A great fiction book based on non-fiction events without a sappy love story.  A thinking woman's escape from the everyday!
Loved the historical events.  Susanna m a les me want to book a vacation to see these places for myself.
Lovely romance book without all the nasty stuff.  Great read, kept me guessing until then end and crying when I got there.
Great characters draw you in and don't let go.  Engaging, creative, perfect.  Looking forward to more books from this talented author.

I wasn't going to review it (there are already so many reviews), but I found the other reviews were a bit harsh. Yes, you could guess some of the instances, but that doesn't mean you wanted to be right, or that you knew for sure you would be right. And that's not so different from so many other books- most of the historical romances I read I can predict. What made this book, to me, so delicious was the way it was written. I have the quote from here hanging on my wall now: "Where'e'er I go, my Soul shall stay with thee: 'Tis but my Shadow that I take away" Being in love with a sailor, this book touched my soul. I ached with loving and love with the characters. It left me contemplating a lot of things, and that to me is the very point of an excellent book. This book took me on a journey and left me both sad to see it end and thinking about it well after it ended.
if you love historical fiction, you'll love this book!  very detailed description of events and wonderful tie in to current day fiction in Scotland.

The story involves the present day author writing a historical fiction from the view point of an ancestor.  The movement between the time periods is flawless and the reader easily relates to the main characters.  Once engaged in the story line this is an excellent and hard to put down story.
This author reminds me of Victoria Holt and Inglis Fletcher. Two authors I read years ago and I really enjoyed.

This was the first book by Susanna Kearsley that I've read and it won't be the last.  I loved the characters and how the book flowed from  past to present.  The author has a knack for hooking you right into the story and after that it's hard to put the book down.  Although the love scenes where discrete, I found myself actually liking it better.  It allowed me to use my own imagination.  The ending was good but I have to say I'd love to see another book with these same character's.  I definitely see more story here.  With that being said, I would highly recommend this book.

Susanna Kearsley's 'The Winter Sea' is simply awesome! I took my time reading this book so I could savor every word, every scene. This is a definite keeper. I plan to read every one of Susanna Kearsley's wonderful books.
I've read Rose Garden and Marianna and they were excellent, but I think this is my favorite book from this author so far.  And I loved the ending! I would highly recommend.
I am not a fan of romantic novels usually but this one moved me greatly and I must reconsider, a great story superbly told.
2nd time I have read this book. Enjoyed the connections between the past historical novel she is writing  and the present day author.  Very interesting to suppose DNA MEMORY. A different perspective

I received this book as one of amazon's free or reduced price books. Thank you Amazon for turning me onto a brilliant writer. The story was set in a time and location I knew lottle about beforehand. The Winter Sea made me want to know more - about the time, about the events, about the characters, and about the connection.

This book was unnecessarily long. Granted, I was trying to finish it quickly for a book club. I couldn't tell if during the flash back scenes the author was trying to be a bit tongue in cheek with all the schmaltz. In the end I couldn't go to the club, but I would be curious to see what the other members thought of it. I wouldn't recommend it personally.
Enjoyable escapist read!  Loved the history and the parallel stories.  Could have used a little more character development of the protaganist and love interests.
I enjoyed the interplay between the historical settings and the contemporary scenes.  The author did an excellent job of intertwining two similar stories.
This a wonderful love story, coming of age novel, filled with history and intrigue!  Would love to follow the characters further.
This was my first Susanna Kearsley book and I enjoyed it so much I bought The Rose Garden. Enjoyable, easy to read book.

I love this author that I've recently discovered.  This is the 2nd of her books that I've read.  She weaves wonderful stories between the past and the present and I love the characters that are very believable.

Susanna Kearsley is a very good writer.  Although all of her books have a paranormal twist of some sort, she creates engaging characters and she has a great sense of history, so the flow is good and the read is fun and enjoyable.  This was the first one of her books I read, and I enjoyed it so much I've read three more.  If you're not a fan of paranormal explanations and/or historical novels, this may not be your cup of tea.  Otherwise, enjoy yourself!
Great book! I love how she draws you in. First with her life, then with her Heroin in her story. You won't be disappointed with this book.. :)
It grabs you on the first page and never lets go. It will touch your heart and make you cry. It also takes you on a wonderful adventure thru time. I loved it !!!!

because the sequel will be published soon and you don't want to miss it! The twining of historical characters with everyday life in evocative prose makes for exceptional reading. I have been to these places and I want to return immediately!
The kind of book that makes you want to read thru the night until you finish, and then you want to read the sequel.

I didn't want to give up on this author after reading Mariana, which was a 3 star to me, and wanted to check this out especially after a read from a lot of reviewer that it was a better book. Surprisingly, I found Mariana to be a much better book. This was gloomy, incredibly predictable and utterly unbelievable. Would not recommend. Read Mariana instead.
I really enjoyed the history of this romantic  tale. The connection between heroines was well done and quite original. I would recommend the book.
I loved the setting and the way this book went in and out of the past. A different twist on a historical novel.
It was a quick easy read--great for vacation etc.  it has been about a year since I read this book but the premise, characters, and story have remained with me!
What a heart wrencher! Both stories pull you in.  This book wouldnt work without both, the stories belong together.  The ending only sweetens the deal.
Enjoyed this book that we read for our book group.  Good for discussion, and an easy read!  Would definitely recommend.
An amazing book that entranced me from beginning to end. The characters live and breathe the history of Ireland. Filled with beauty and romance.

This book was one of my favorite books of all time.  The writing was descriptive enough to paint a picture, but didn't drag.  I felt truly connected to the characters and felt their emotions as they felt them.  The historical references were explained in a way that tied into the storyline and I didn't feel like I needed to do my own research to understand the plot.  However, this book piqued my interest on the history of Scotland (beyond Braveheart).  This is a book that I will read again and I'm excited to read other books by Susanna Kearsley.

I enjoyed the way the author inter weaved the two storylines together and switched back and forth between the two!  I could hardly wait to find out how everything was going to come together-and the author did a great job of it! I also was pleased to find out that the historical characters did, in fact, exist in real life!

I was very skeptical going in to this book. I generally take my history and romance separately. But the history was well written and accurate (for historical fiction, anyway) and the romance was lovely.

Expecting a light romance set in the past, I was pleasantly surprised to find a much more interesting story.  I very much enjoyed the connection between past and present and the accurate use of historical detail made this a very believable story.  Ms. Kearsley really brought the characters to life.

I loved reading this novel! I stayed up late to read this night after night and during my lunch hour. I couldn't wait to see what was going to happen next! It was beautifully written, and intertwined the past with the present seamlessly. I immediately bought another book from this author.

I had read The Rose Garden also be Susanna Kearsley and decided to follow-up with "Winter Sea."  It was fantastic!  The perfect blend of history with an element of romance of the time period.  It's setting in Scotland drew me in very quickly.  I would recommend this book to anyone with similar interests.
The Winter Sea was my Book Club's pick. I am so glad to have been introduced to Susanna Kearsley's books! I love them! You won't be disappointed!
I could not put it down. A wonderful love story in the midst of some amazing history. Awesome reviews from those I passed it on to as well.

This was a great book.  Love the way it intertwined the past and present.  It keptmy attention from the very beginning.  Well written and I would definitely recommend it to anyone who is interested in historical fiction.
Love this story!  Engaging and entertaining.  Don't be put off by the changing from old times to current times, it actually helps to keep the story moving forward.

This is my favorite Kearsley novel.  Her writing is easy to read, has a consistent flow.  The story is about an author telling the story she is writing, two stories in one.  I loved the setting, Slain Castle.  I learned a little history at the same time enjoying a good read.  The best part of this novel is the unexpected ending.

I stumbled across Susanna Kearsley, and have been thrilled ever since. THE WINTER SEA has everything I want in a book: wonderfully-developed characters, a fascinating story set in an equally fascinating period of history, and a marvelous sense of place, lyrically described. I would go on, but you'll have to excuse me... another Kearsley book is calling my name!

I started reading Kearsley with Shadowy Horses and fell in love with her writing style. So I made it my business to read all her other books. While this was a good book, it was my least favorite (others being Mariana and The Rose Garden). I would still recommend it to those who enjoy Kearsley's writing, but I think there is such a thing as too descriptive, and this book suffered from excessive description.

This is my second book by this author and I love her style of writing and story lines. In her books so far her main characters seem to always go from present day to a distant past,  each time in a different way. She also has a wonderful way of drawing you in to the characters, where you want to keep reading to see what happens next. I am so glad I have discovered her work, and look forward to her other books
Read one of her books at library...then got my Kindle Paperwhite as gift.  So began reading her books in sequence.  Love her writing style.
This is one of my favorite Susanna Kearsley books.  I read it in a matter of 3 days and reread it the same month.  I definitely recommend, especially if you have read Susanna Kearsley before.
Despite a hesitant beginning I quickly warmed to the story and it has ultimately become one of my favorite books!
I found this story very hard to put down.  I loved the back and forth between "Carrie" and "Sophia" and their stories.

I loved this book. I could not put it down. It drew me in and kept me there. I just cannot say enough about how much I enjoyed this book. The crazy thing is, I have my genealogy traced back to Scotland, my grandmother many generations back is a Drummond, Lilias, she is Anne Drummonds sister. I knew I had seen that name before, I went back and found it. My fathers family is from Scotland.  This was exciting.  I would recommend this book to anyone who loves historical fiction, it is an awesome read. It is a five story.
I absolutely loved this book. I have read none other like it. Highly Recommend. The story and writing are Awsome!!

Read this book it is wonderful.  I could not read fast enough.  Beautiful love story wrapped in history and they left the sex scenes to my imagination. Don't get me wrong, I like love scenes but I don't need 6 pages of skin caress details.  I can't wait to read something else by this author.
Loved the book and the perspective it was written from. Thoroughly enjoyed the book and the discovery of a new author!
What could have been a really good story lost a lot because the author doesn't seem to trust her readers. Too heavy handed, with an ending a little too creepy.

The book has two plots and many characters. If you are not careful you will mix up which character goes with which plot. Both stories are exciting and full of history and romance. Kearsley has a gift with words and colorful descriptions. The plot could have moved faster but the detail was good
Once I started reading I couldn't put the book down!  What an amazing story!  Very well written!  History, Romance, Intrigue all in this Book!
I love it when I find a new author and have a new pile of books to read.  What a treat for me.  My only regret is that I didn't buy her whole catalog when it was on sale.
Winter Sea by Susanna Kearsley.  I absolutely LOVED this book!  The author transitioned in time so well, I don't always like when an author does that.  Would definitely recommend this book.
This is the third book written by Susanna Kearsley that I have read and have thoroughly enjoyed them. I love that they are based on real people and events in history!
Author does a great job of weaving historical fiction with modern life. Well written dialog and story line.  Good book.
This work grabs you from the start and never drags. Exciting. Historically accurate. Romantic. Intriguing at every turn. I can't wait to read her other books.
With two stories in one, the book was a little tedious in parts. It's an average to below average beach read.

I love the way Susanna can beautifully blend history and  romance with the past and the present!  Although, Mariana is still my favorite, I still enjoyed Winter Sea.  Right when I think I had the ending figured out, I was pleasantly surprised!

This book was interesting the way it jumped from the author's life to the story of Sophia, so it was not totally based in the past. I have rarely read a book that has made me cry, but this one did.  I felt as sad as Sophia did in the book.  Therefore, I found it to be a well-written book!  I highly recommend this book to those who enjoy a good historical romance!
This is historical fiction at it's very best.  I am now reading another of this author's novels.  I intend to read them all.

I have now read 4 of her books.  This one takes some very interesting twists.  You can count on her to have happy endings, which I like.  The ending was not quite what I expected but still very well done.  If you liked Marianna, you will really enjoy this.

Susanna Kearsley weaves an imaginative, engaging historical romance in the Winter Sea. Her characters are approachable and believable and the history in the plot line is interesting.  I find myself routing for the love of the main characters in the past and present and can't wait to find out what happens to them page by page.  I would highly recommend any of the author's books to readers who enjoy historical fiction and romance intertwined with a bit of fantasy.
I really liked this book. It was the third book that I've read by Susanna Kearsley and I think this one ties for first with one of her earlier books, The Shadowy Horses.

Both Goodreads and Amazon have had this book near the top of my recomendations for many months and I continually passed it by. Something about the cover, the 'look' of it just did not appeal. I've no idea exactly why. I finally did get it though and proceeded to lose sleep the past two nights reading. I loved it! I was so saddened to reach the end and know I was leaving these characters and I can give no higher praise to any book. It's haunting, the locations so real I could feel the mist and spray around me.....so well written. These people seemed to leap off the page at me, drawing me into their worlds both old and new. I've not read anything previously by this author but i surely will be now. Although I can not imagine that anything she has written before or since will strike me with the same impact that this book did.  I am hopeful her other titles will be so engrossing to me as this one was.

It's not the author's fault...she was a really great writer and it's a creative premise.  My problem is that is a big departure from my tastes.  I like historic novels, but not romance.  This book has a lot of history and a sci-fi premise, but is mostly romance.  I got bored with it and quit reading it in favor of another book.
Wonderful book, can't wait to read more! Nothing like a book that you simply can't put down and leaves you fulfilled and satisfied at the end! More Kearsley please!

I have been tempted by reading one of Susanna Kearsley's novels for awhile, but I thought it might have too much romance for me. I saw a review by someone I respect so I decided to read this one. I was sold by the fact that it takes place in a castle on the Scottish shores. This was decent historical fiction with a bit of supernatural as the contemporary character, Carrie, a writer of historical fiction starts to feel she is writing her story from memories, not research. The historical story about Sophie, an orphan living with a wealthy relative who is part of a conspiracy to bring King James II back to his rightful place on the throne of England. The history was interesting, the story compelling. There was romance and I even enjoyed it. This is a great weekend read. I think I will read another by this author.
The characters, plots and settings were wonderful and rich.  Easy to cozy up to and lose yourself in.  Looking forward to her new book.
Beautiful book! Thanks so much for a fast and efficient transaction!! Shopping Amazon is the greatest! I recommend it to all my friends!
Loved the story and the story-within-the-story. Not chock full of explosive action but the main characters are endearing and it was a very satisfying story.
Very well written!! I love Scotland anyway, so I am entranced!!!! I will read all of her books. Great read!
She is an incredible writer.  She absolutely takes you to these places and you feel right at home there.  It's so sad when the story ends and you have tell these characters good bye.

This book had an interesting story line but was utterly passionless. I keep reading to see if there would be more to the story and the characters interaction but it just left me flat. I give it three stars only because I liked the story line and plot but only 2 stars otherwise.
A bit of a time travel treat woven into a modern day romance. Loved the setting, story and characters as well as the interesting piece of history. A bit edge-of-the-seat too!

Read this as kind of a "filler" while waiting for Diana Gabaldon's next book.  Kearsley has a slightly different take on the time travel romantic escape historical novel. Her love scenes are of the  "He took her into his arms ***" variety.  That's what old movies did with the wild embrace cutting to the window view of the crashing  crescendo of waves. All in all though, it was a fun read. Work on those love scenes, Susanna!  We're all adults here.

This book, although difficult to follow with all of the history, was so interesting that I wanted to find out more about the time period.  At first it was harder to follow alonog with historical facts, just because my own knowlege of that time period is not great.  The author, however, is wonderful about revisiting important events, that after a while, I felt like I was proficient in my understanding.  The best part was the fact that it brought history and modern times together in one story.  Loved it!  Loved it!

I rarely find a book that I could read a second time, but this book I can.  I could not put this book down.  This is my first read from Susanna Kearsley, and I will definitely be reading more of her writings.. I do only wish that all of her titles were available for Kindle.
I loved the premise of this book ... a writer writing about writing a book.  The history bogged down in a few places, but it was well written and kept my interest for the most part.
I enjoyed reading this book very much, it blends the past with the present and keeps you wondering until the very end. I enjoy the history that is incorporated into the storyline also.

I am not usually a historical fiction fan, but this book blends fiction/fantasy in a way that dragged me in from the first page. I would highly recommend this book - but be prepared to shut the whole world out for a day.
This is such a great story. I loved the history. This author makes you feel like you are there. I cried, smiled, and hugged my iPad when I finished.

Winter Sea is my favorite of Kearsley's books so far.  The era, setting, plot were perfect.  I learned so much more about that period in time - where my ancestors are actually from - than ever before.  The ending was perfect.
An ageless love story for those whosoever have thought or questioned, “I have said, done, or been this once before"?
Still reading this book, but quite caught up by this authors style.Very smooth transitions between the now and then. Would recommend to history buffs.

This was the best book I have read in a long time. I have heard of this author , but never read any of her stories before. I will be looking for more of her work. If you are a fan of history with a little romance and a surprise ending, then this is the book for you
A very enjoyable read. I enjoyed learning about the Jacobites and plot to bring back young King James. The surprise ending was the best.
This book kept me up for a few nights.  Couldn't put it down.  Loved the way the writer moved back and forth between centuries.  Her characters were wonderful.

This story within a story feels like a fantasy but nicely blends with science. Romance and history also work well together without the romance getting silly. While the ending was somewhat predictable there were still enough unexpected plot twists to keep me interested and caring about the characters. Altogether a very pleasant historical romance.

Fantastic and original concept of historical fiction, shifting between the historical fiction book being written and the author's life. I thouroughly enjoyed this book and had a very hard time putting it down.  Extremely well written with nicely developed characters and a realistic, truly satisfying ending.

I bought this book on a whim a few months back based on positive reviews and I am so glad that I did.  The storytelling was wonderful and I had such a feeling of happiness when I had finished.  I recently lent it to my mother and she raved about it for days, too.  I'm looking forward to reading more novels by Susanna Kearsley!
This book sucked me in from the first page on. Well written, amazing characters! I recommend this book to all who love history and romance.

This is a heartfelt, yet mysterious novel. The plot is brilliant. A novelist begins writing a novel that has her enthralled--she rents a cottage on the coast of Scotland, in view of the ruins of Slaine Castle. As she writes the novel, she discovers that research she's doing confirms the historicty of what she thought to be the fiction of her own creation. As her novel, her past life, and her current life become entwined together, a love story from the past and a new one emerging in the present are told with a deeply felt voice. I love Ms. Kearsley's works--they are quiet, mystical, and breathtaking.
Great story. Great characters.  Now I am completely hooked on Kearsley.  She cannot write new books fast enough for me.

Susanna Kearsley is such an excellent author. She captured my attention with her writing from beginning to end. Love historical fiction and this checked all the boxes for me. I quickly bought everything else she has written and have read them as well. Can't wait for her new book to become available.
This book intertwines  present and past lives back and forth so skillfully you get caught up in both waiting for what is going to happen in both worlds! Great read late into the night.

A friend recommended this book however by her description I was not sure I would enjoy it - I was very mistaken.  I couldn't put it down and  especially enjoyed how the author brought the story to a close - well done.

Having chosen this book based upon previous reviews, I felt compelled to add my own two cents.  This book is wonderfully written with a depth of emotion that could easily have been overdone/underdone.  Full of wonderful history, believable characters and a story twist that catches you by surprise.  A must read with great depth and a interesting story line.

Great historical fiction and interesting ideas about "genetic memory."  I haven't read anything on the Jacobites and the failed invasion of 1708 to try to restore the Scottish crown to James Stewart, so I learned a lot as well. I will definitely try another Susanna Kearsley book!
As someone who's been into genealogy for 25 years I LOVE the idea that you could inherit memories. Who hasn't gone to a place at one time and thought it seemed familiar?

Thoroughly enjoyable historical fiction...my favorite kind of book!  This was the first time I read one of Susanna's books.  Her creativity in writing this Scottish history as dictated to her by the main character made it a page-turner for me.

Kept me involved for the entire book. I will be exploring the rest of this authors books. Loved it. I didn't want to finish because I became so bonded to the characters but could not put it down at the same time. As opposed to seeing words the words became mental images, so well written.
The kind of book you don't want to end.  Enjoyed the characters and how they were fleshed out. A little predictable but nice ending.

I loved this story - so wonderfully designed - I thought the premise of having inherited memories of ancestors was a little hokey but also interesting.  I felt the flow/transition from modern day to previous times were very very well done.  And a great ending that I wasn't expecting.  This was an excellent book - one I will remember and I just felt very satisfied by the time I got to the ending.  Well done!!  I will take a look at other books by this author.  This was the first one I read by her.  Don't miss it!!

I happened upon this book through Pixel of Ink and am very glad I did.  Truly enjoyed the story.  Susanna Kearsley has a great way of keeping the book intriguing.  I like the way she intertwines the story from the past to the future.  Definitely would recommend to anyone that enjoys historical fiction with a touch of romance.  I enjoy 'old' history especially of the Scottish/Irish/English nature and this has all that.  The ending may surprise you!  Somewhat similar to Diana Gabaldon, which is another author I truly enjoy, but no time travel involved.  I will be looking for more of Susanna Kearsley books to read.
Good plot with an interesting twist.  Well written and I would recommend, especially if you enjoy historical novels.  Made me want to visit the coast of Scotland!

I just finished with "The Winter Sea" and I really liked it.  This is the kind of book I would have written myself.  A writer moving to Scotland to research an historical novel, duel romances in this time and in 1708, memories coming through DNA, a couple of good plot twists, highly atmospheric.  The only thing I would have liked more of was a more literary feel to the prose.  While it did provide beautiful, well crafted sentences occasionally, its style was more often than not just matter of fact.  The author took on a lot of history, maybe more than the story itself required. But to learn while being entertained is never wasted.  I recommend this to readers who like a good romance with paranormal overtones, to history buffs of the Jacobite era, and those wishing to experience a bit of Scotland. I would love to see this one as a movie.  The scenery alone would elevate the story to a wonderful experience...
This is a very well written tale of two couples, two periods of history and two cultures, woven brilliantly into one excellent read.

Winter Sea is a good read but the historical facts got in the way of the fictional characters.  I really like historical fiction.  I have read all of Diana Gabaldon's books and was looking forward to Winter Sea being similar,which it was, but I just couldn't get into caring about King James.  The past and present characters were very interesting in and of themselves. I would have rather more written about their stories than the detail regarding what was going on at the time regarding the Scottish throne.

This is one of the best written books I have read.  I am a romance novel enthusiast and the writing was simply enchanting.  This is the story of a writer and her love story, while being "possessed" by her character and a heart wrenching love story that turns out to be real.  I could not put it down.  I will definitely read more from this author.  Superb writing, enthralling and beautifully romantic.

This is one of the best books Ive read in a few years.  The detail the author puts into her stories is amazing.  She intertwined the characters and provided such mystery and surprise.  I LOVED IT.  Will be reading more from her.

I loved this book! it was a wonderful story that kept me glued to the pages till the end.  That is a big deal believe me.  Deffinately worth the money. can't wait for more of her books to go to kindle.

The author's style is appealing writing in the first person. This is a romantic novel with the plot more suitable for the female gender. After I started reading it, I recognized that this might not be for me. However I found myself wanting to find out how it all ended. In short, the novel turned out to be a pleasant read.
This book was very hard to put down.  I wanted to read it in one sitting but life must go on.  I enjoyed the historical aspect especially.  Good read!

Susanna Kearsley crafted this book so well that you are equally invested in both stories.  The premise is so well done that the moves between past and present are flawless and do not seem forced.  If you're looking for steamy, you won't find it here, but the story doesn't suffer for it. What a great read!  At the end I was left wanting more!

Oh my gosh.  I loved this book.  I read Kearsley's 'Rose Garden' first....in one day.  'Winter Sea' was a bit longer, but I loved it even more.  The story was so good and so well written.  There was romance, drama, history, and lots of surprises along the way.  The ending was absolutely perfect.  Even though I bought this on my Kindle, I may go buy the paperback so that I can have the physical book too.  I just finished tonight and already have recommended it to some friends.

Can't say enough about how much I enjoyed this book. I loved how it tied the past and present together...always kept you thinking and trying to figure things out. A must read for any Historical Fiction fan.

The publisher's description was misleading as mentioned in at least one negative review, but I enjoyed the book anyways.  I was expecting more of a modern fantasy thriller type novel.  What I got was a modern day romance novel (but not a graphic bodice ripper) interlaced with a historical fiction romance novel set in 18th century Scotland.  This isn't a genre I choose very often.  Still the premise of the modern heroine being descended from the ancient one was a unique twist and it was a good story.  The historical fiction part seemed to be pretty well researched, although I am no expert.  I found the style somewhat reminiscent of Diana Gabaldon's Outlander series.  All in all this infrequent reader of Historical Romance novels enjoyed this accidental find.

I am a HUGE fan of Diana Gabaldon's books.  Having said that, I also love history, and this book made history come alive in a unique way that was a delight.  I totally recommend this book.  I downloaded it from my library website for free.  I have a 14 day rental period from the library, but finished this in less than 5 hours.  I loved the characters, the setting and the overall vibe of this book.  I laughed, I cried and I was completely immersed in the lives of all involved.
I loved this book! So moving. I loved the blending of past and present. I would recommend to anyone who loves a great love story!
Hands down, the best time travel, historical romance I have read so far. Brilliant and endearing. I laughed and cried and in the end I felt hope for my own long lost love.
This held my attention, it was definitely worth reading. Based on historical events combined with current times.  There was intrigue, romance and mystery.  Thank you

This was my first book by Kearsley.  I will probably read more of her work as I like historical fiction.  It was well written and the plot moved quickly.  I guessed the ending well before I read it, but still a good read.

Obviously loved this Kindle book.  I read it while I was on a trip to make some tough family decisions and really loved that this book "took me away" when the other stuff got too tough to handle. It was definitely an escape read but I got so involved in the characters that I actually cried through the last part of the book and need to go read it again to make sure I didn't miss anything! If you like "time travel" type books with some romance, this is a read for you. Really!!

I have read a few of SK's books and I always feel like I'm sitting next to a fire wrapped up in a blanket and she's reading the book to me. This book is not a time travel book but can sometimes make you feel it is. She does a fantastic job knowing when to end one time period and begin the other in order to keep her reader intrigued and anxious to find out what they have missed while in another century. Beautiful writing that puts you right where the book takes place and when you're done you want to go back. She gives us the joy of reading the romance of two different couples with both heroines being strong, smart women and the heroes being stoic and mysterious. SK is known for her ability to mold the romance between the H/H with such passion but leaves out the explicit sex scenes....I am one that love an explicit sex scene....but I find I am still very satisfied with her version. SK is one of the few authors that I purchase the actual book even though I own a Kindle.

This book intrigued me from the time I read the review (at noon on a Monday night) until I finished the book (at 3am on Wednesday night). I found myself thinking about the plot while at work. I found that I could relate to BOTH characters even though one was based 300 years in the past. I've never really gotten into historical fiction (I'm afraid history in school was not a favorite) but the way the author interpreted it actually made me sit up and pay attention (please take note of this Mr. Griffith) and I wanted to learn more about the history of Scotland and the fight to control the crown. I do realize how religion plays a role in history, past and current, but it always intrigues me to learn the lengths that people will go to prove something instead of just doing the morally right thing. Hmm I feel I've regressed off the book but it was such an eye-opener to me. Bravo. Two-thumbs up. Buy this book for yourself and one for your friend to read as well so you have someone to discuss it with :)

I wasn't too sure about reading this book but am so glad that I did.  It started out kind of slow but still kept me wanting to read more.  When I got to the middle of the book I couldn't put it down.  I fell in love with the characters.  My idea of a good book is when I can "fall into" the storyline and "hear" the characters when they're talking (sounds wierd but that's how I describe it).  This book did that for me.  I didn't want the story to end and already downloaded her next book.  Great read for the price.  I think I bought it when it was offered as a daily deal so it was a fantastic bargain!
I truly loved this book.  I'd not read anything by this author before, but I have added a number of her books to my "to read" list.

This is my first book by Susanna Kearsley. I actually purchased it as an ebook and audiobook. I loved it in both formats - in fact, I often read along on my Kindle while listening to the audiobook (narrator: Rosalyn Landor). I truly had a difficult time taking breaks because I was so caught up in the story - or stories - of both modern-day Carrie and Jacobite Sophia. The characters were so real to me, as were the relationships - some true and faithful, some deceitful. I enjoyed the intensity of the love relationships of the couples whose stories are told, without all the unnecessary details. I also thoroughly appreciated learning more of the true history of the period. I have happily recommended this book to others and do so again here. It is a story to think about long after the read is done.
A lovely and engaging story that paints a vivid picture of the lives and events of the time as historical fiction should.  Entertainment dollars well spent!

I read this book in two days.  I couldn't put it down.  At first I thought this would be some sort of time-travel book and might be cheesy but with so many positive reviews I gave it a chance.  I am so glad I did.  This is not a cheesy time-travel novel.  It is a beautiful story that will have you feeling so many emotions you'll forget that you're not actually in the book yourself.  The characters have such wonderful personalites and stories to tell you'll love all of them.  As with most good books I read I was so sad for this book to end and to have to say good bye to Sophia and Moray.  Can't wait to read another Susanna Kearsley book!

The only reason I gave this book 4 stars instead of five is because it started off quite slow for me. But after digging in a little further it became quite the page turner. Fun to read the two stories with in one, and to see the romance unfolding and how it all ends...just so good!

This book became a page turner.  Semi-predictable plot, but once I got into it, it was hard to put down.  Amazing imagery - had to look up the village and castle featured in the book.  Yeah, some of it is a bit farfetched, but the author did a good job of weaving multiple story-lines together seamlessly.  Worth the read if you are a historical fiction buff.

I just finished Winter Sea and found it be entertaining.  I tend to like historical fiction and avoid romance novels.  That being said, there was enough history in this book and not an overpowering amount of romance.  This book was light on history which is not always a bad thing because I learned things throughout the story, yet was not overburdened with so many names that I got lost.  I recommended it to my sister,Vivian.  She loves the Outlander series so I think she might enjoy this one.

The characters in this book become part of you. Couldn't put this book down and was sad when it I was done with it.I haven't cried while reading in years last author able to do that to me was Danielle Steele. I love how Suzanna blends history, romance and suspense..Worth reading !!

I enjoyed this novel very much. It was well-written and atmospheric, with lots of detail. I enjoyed the descriptions of coastal life and the experience of writing a book. The main character's relationship with Stewy and the "conflict" surrounding this was hard to believe, but the idea of ancestral memory was presented convincingly enough that I had to wonder if I could experience the same thing if I found the right place to visit. The plot twists were predictable, but I still cried at the ending.

This book was elegantly written spanning space and time. The connection with the characters was very strong and the book truly took the reader out of reality and transported them to Scotland. Love! Love! Love!

This book was so well written and hard to put down. I didn't realize when I bought it just how much I would enjoy her writing. I have preordered her newest novel. Winter Sea has an unusual plot but flowed so nicely.

I loved, loved, loved,this book.  I was immediately drawn into the story and stayed there.  The book ended much too soon and would like to see a book on the heroine's daughter who had to be left in Scotland.  It would tie in nicely with the book's ending.  The intertwining of the past and the present stories was quite good.  I was very disappointed not to find any of her other books available on Kindle.  What is the chance of that happening sooner rather than later.  A very good read.
I thought this book was wonderful. Great character development, scene description and loved the historical fiction angle. My favorite book of the summer.
i could not put it down. each chapter captured and enchanted me. wished the story could have lasted twice as long.

This was a lovely book, enjoyed all the characters and historical perspectives. The scenes flowed among the various settings and it all kept my attention. A wonderful novel, highly recommend to those who enjoy a good story, well formed characters, great dialogue and a well-paced page-turner. Going to find her other novels, looking forward to more of her stories.

I enjoyed this book very much. I was amazed to find out the characters were actually real. A lot of research was put into this story. I couldn't put down.  I felt transported back in time & I was able to visualize the settings & hear the accent of the characters when they spoke.  Very well written & I look forward to reading more from Susanna Kearsley.

Ok, just to let everyone know, I have never written a review before. After reading this 500+ book in a weekend, I knew I had stumbled onto a rare find. This book has everything you could possibly want, romance, war, death and of course mystery with a splash of some sort of supernatural. Please read this book, I can not recommend a better book!! BEST EVER!

I thoroughly enjoyed everything about this book.  I just can't say enough, so I am going to give you the "in a nutshell" version: The story line, he well-crafted writing, and perfect closure came together for a very satisfying read. Loved it!

I read a lot, and I can honestly say that this is one of the best books I've read in years. It's unique and I fully intend to read more Susanna Kearsley books. I would highly recommend this book to anyone. I bought this on kindle and couldn't have been more pleased with it. READ THIS BOOK.

I just finished the Kindle edition of this book a moment ago and WOW. This is now one of my favorite books of all time.  Right up there with the books I love by Kate Morton.  Susanna Kearsley is an amazing author! I'm so glad I discovered this book!

There are few books that captivate me in such a way that I never tired of taking them off the bookshelf to re-read certain favorite parts over and over. Winter Sea is one of those books. I felt the romances were handled tastefully and could stand proudly without the typical smutty descriptions of love scenes that normally accompany Scottish romances. Kearsley also weaves history in with the present day in a very fluid manner. I felt like I gained an intriguing passionate history lesson with none of the boring parts. Indeed, I think the author convinced me to be a Jacobite myself.

I really loved this book.  The story within a story held my attention and I was anxious to go from one to the other.  There were a few parts that were a little boring and had more historical information than I like...but all in all, I enjoyed this book thoroughly and will, I'm sure, read it again in a year or two.  I will certainly read more of Susanna Kearsley's novels..but this one will always be my first love.

I thoroughly enjoyed this book and am seriously sleep-deprived because of it.  Her story within a story was fascinating and I appreciated her historical detail.  I'm just very disappointed that, apparently, none of her other books are available for Kindle!

I thoroughly enjoyed this book!  I liked the characters and unique way the author developed the story line.  The only problem I have with this book is because she was going back and forth between timelines, not all of the characters were as developed as I would have liked.  This is a book that I will, without hesitation, happily recommend to my family and friends.

I was immediately drawn into this novel and enjoyed it throughout. The ending wasn't what I expected- definitely a pleasant surprise. Highly recommended if you like historical fiction with a romance-y tinge.

LOVE this book!! It's historical fiction, and I found the plot and all the characters fascinating. It takes place in Scotland - both present day and in the early 1700s. I happen to love Scottish accents so I tried to read the book with an accent in my head - I was fairly successful at it.  Anyways, the book is amazing. I recommend to everyone, but especially those who want to learn some Scottish history.  For $2.99 this book is a steal!!!

This book kept me coming back for more. The characters pulled me in and become real. Susanna Kearsley wrote so masterfully that I felt the hope, anticipation, and pain that Sophia held. I enjoyed the way Kearsley weaved historical and fiction to make a novel that captured my heart.
A delightful tale and creative strategy of switching from the authors life to the novel.  Full of interesting history with two ongoing stories.  I loved this book.

I loved this book.  After finishing, I read it again.  As many have stated, I could not put it down.  The funny thing is, I cannot really pinpoint what I enjoyed so much about it.  It's not like it was a fast moving, exciting book.  I just loved the story, the flow, and how it made me feel.  It's one of those books that you can actually hear the sounds and voices, and feel like you are there in the setting.  I've actually had trouble moving on to other books because I can't put this one aside.

The narrative drew me in almost immediately, and swept me along - I read this book in its entirety during the first sitting. I loved how the author skilfully illustrated historical characters and brought them to life for me, and I appreciated the HEA ending. I was disappointed that I would have to wait for another book from Kearsley.
I could not put this book down!  I really enjoyed how Susanna Kearsley blended the modern with the historical times in this story.  It held my attention through to the end!

I was lucky enough to get this book when it was on a special rate of $2.99.  I had never heard of Susanna Kearsley, the author, but figured for that cheap a price I would give it a try. This book was so good!  This is a story within a story and I was concerned that the back and forth between Carrie, the main character who is an author and the characters Carrie wrote about in her book would seem disjointed, but the (real) author did a wonderful job making everything flow seamlessly. I highly recommend this book. It was really very good.  I will be reading more by Susanna Kearsley and will be fine paying full price!

I originally got this book when it was part of the Top 100 free kindle books, some time back.  The cover looked interesting and the few reviews it had made it sound like a good book.  I am not normally a fan of historical fiction but decided to give it a try and I am happy I did.  At first the book was rather slow and I found myself wishing that I could just follow Carrie's story and not Sophia's but this changed after the first couple of chapters.  I think the problem with those chapters was that similar things happen to Carrie and Sophia so some of the story seems repetitive, however at some point after that I think when all the main characters and the background are introduced the story flows very well between the past and modern day.  The author does a really good job of setting up the historical background and I really appreciated her use of one of the main character's as a history professor to summarize the historical events that occurred at different points in the book.  Although the direction of the story was slightly predictable overall this book is well written, I enjoyed reading it, and I would purchase it if I had not gotten it as a free kindle book.

Hands down one of the best modern novels I have read. The author takes such a creative spin on the "time travel/historical romance." All her characters are so vivid as well. I truly enjoyed it, and wished it hadn't of ended.

I truly enjoyed this book. I am an avid reader and have yet to find anything remotely close to the intrinsically entertaining value of this book. No heavy sex and a lot of bare bones historical facts. I love historical fiction but am not a history buff. This author was able to take me there and educate me with out me having to drag out the encyclopedia. Too bad her other books are not Kindle friendly.

i did enjoy this book very much.  the author has a wonderful way of making you feel like you are a part of the story with great details.  the historical background was great and was pleased with the way the story fell into place.  looking forward to her next novel.

I started this book in the bookstore several times and thought to buy it, but was not sure.  I finally decided to try it this summer and have been searching for something like it again.  It was wonderful and the history in it rich and accurate.  I have since read Outlander which I would also highly reccomend, but found The Winter Sea to be more accurate to names/dates/places if that is important to you.  Author did a nice job bouncing between then and now and not confusing me along the way, which sometimes happens.  Between the two books I am starting a savings to make a trip to Scotland/Ireland to see the lands myself.  Excellent book!

I couldn't put this down.  If you have Scots-Irish roots, you will be immersed in this book and feel an immediate kinship with the characters.  It is beautifully written and weaves historical facts into a beautiful love story.  The characters portray a loyalty to king and each other that we long for in our own modern times.

I have downloaded over 400 books onto my Kindles over the last 3 years, but have written almost no reviews.  After finishing this book (in the wee hours of the morning this morning), I woke up knowing I had to write a review.  This was a wonderful book, with great characters and a really interesting concept.  I am a fan of books set in Scotland, both present and past (think Diana Gabaldon), and this hit the mark in both centuries.  The author didn't get too caught up in the historical aspect in terms of describing how castles were cleaned, lit, etc., but the characters are marvelous and the book flowed really well.  There are a couple twists and turns that made the book even more enjoyable.  I highly recommend you read this book, and I hope the author publishes more soon.

The author brings Sophia to life in the body of a female descendant. She takes her back and forth through time seamlessly! Outside characters don't "get in the way" and she never gets bogged down in boring details. This is a page turner that will bring you to tears more than once.... but leaves you in a good place! kim
A very nice read.  I loved the way it went back and forth between present and past.  I felt like I also went back in time.  The book was one that I really didn't want to end.
susanna kearsley has written an absorbing book.it reminds me of mary stewart and daphne du maurier. it is a well written,tender novel.

I passed over  this book several times before finally deciding to download it to my Kindle. I am so happy I did! What a wonderfully told story. I love the plot, the characters, the setting, the everything about it! I am a huge historical fiction fan, but I am not into the whole historical romance thing. I feel that this book gave a taste of the romance but it wasn't over the top. I will definitely be on the lookout for more from this author. She crafted a beautiful story that gave a wonderful glimpse into the past as well as the present.

I LOVE THIS BOOK.  It has become my favorite of the year.  Now that I have read it, I think I may get the audiobook.  The story within a story is well-written and is never confusing.  You get just enough of each story to keep you going.  It's a heartwrenching good read.  (And has surely made me want to visit Scotland!)
I love this book.  I could not put it down and I felt like I was there experience the events myself.

This book is now one of my top four favorites--I read it in two days. Author shifts seamlessly from modern to past time and interlinks the characters and plots of both. The creative writing style creates pictures in your mind of the old and new Scotland while emotionally charging the reader. For anyone interested in historical fiction, it is a must read!

I really enjoyed this book & would highly recommend for those enjoy historical fiction with a twist.  What I loved most was this author's voice.  The only sad part is that none of her other novels are out on Kindle yet.  It is such a disappointment for those wanting more from this author.  Absolutely worth a read!! I don't think you will be disappointed  - especially as it is $2.99 right now.

I love the Outlander series by Diana Gabaldon, but it kills me to have to wait 3 years for a new book to come out!!! I found this book by accident while researching other books on Kindle. I am so glad i did!!! A very entertaining read...it's full of real history. There was romance, but the good old-fashion kind...not cheesy. I am always reading a new book...this is one of the best ones i've read in a long time.

I admit at first it was a little slow to start but finishing this book was so well worth it. I think some of the people who gave it 2 stars were disappointed that the love scenes were left to our imaginations. I found that to be a wonderful treat. I loved the character Graham!!! At first I really wanted to be back in time but I found myself enjoying the present day scenes so much that I wanted more of those. The history definitely got a little tiresome but the rest of the novel certainly made up for that. I challenge anyone to read the last scene with little Anna and not tear up.

"The Winter Sea" was the best novel I have read in a long time.  It did take me a while to get into the book but by about 40% of the way through the book, I was completely wrapped up into the lives of Sophia and John.  This is a great tale and I love the historical facts.  I did cry many tears of joy and sadness. This was my first Susanna Kearsley book, but I intend to read more.

I thoroughly enjoyed it and it will probably remain one of my favorite reads this year.  I really enjoyed the blend of past and present and while the link between past and present may have been a bit of a far fetch at times, I didn't mind at all.

I loved this book.  The idea of a book within a book was brilliant. The story of Sophia and John wonderful and heart breaking.  I laughed and cried.  Trust me you will not put this book down.  It just draws you in.

Since reading Diana Gabaldon's Outlander series, I have yet to find a book as good as those and have read many in the process of trying to find one. This book however is the closest I have come to finding one almost as enjoyable to read.  I will be reading more by this author. Thanks for a great read Miss Kearsley!
I LOVED THIS BOOK. Not since reading Nancy Turner and Jane Kirkpatrick have I found a writer I liked as much.

I was a little sceptical about a historical that went back and forth between modern day and history, but not to worry, this was fabulous! This was my first book by this author but I am going to read everything else she has written. The historical parts were very engrossing and even the modern day heroine was very likeable.
Beautiful book.  Story was original and ingenuous.  I loved it so much that when I finished the book I felt I wanted to read it again!

I rarely take the time to write reviews.  I will usually pass on my thoughts to those I know that are also avid readers, but this book was one that I felt I needed to share with those that I do not know!  It was well written, the historical storyline was well researched and and interesting period, and the romance in both the present and past was not overdone and contrived. With that said, it sucked me in from the begining and I could not put it down! I highly recommend this book and I am looking forward the reading other books that Suzanna Kearnsley has written.

This is one of the best books I've read this year! I wish her other books were available on Kindle, because I would buy every last one of them if they were! Two concurrent romances, quite the tearjerker! You won't regret reading this one!

The Winter Sea was a fast read for me....and I'm not a fast reader.  I thoroughly enjoyed the characters and found myself caught up in both story lines.  The only reason I did not give it 5 stars is because I guessed the ending before it happened....however, it was the only way this story could end.  Beautiful imagery....it piqued my curiosity enough to go online and look up Cruden Bay and Slains Castle.  Now I want to go there someday!

It has been a long time since a book has made me feel so close to the characters that I have cried. I found myself feeling just what our heroine Sophia did, and couldnt help myself. This is the best book I have read in a very long time.

I enjoyed the book very much.  I liked the idea of a writer living her life in the present while writing a historical fiction book with an interesting connection to the present.  Nice concept ... well written and it kept my interesting.  I will remember this book and it is one I may read again someday.  The book became my friend as some books do.

I have read and fallen in love with many of  this author's books, I am always entranced, always feel the emotion she is portraying...I have laughed, cried, cheered, and felt heartbroken. I highly recommend ANY of her books, but this one has a special place in my heart...I will read and re-read this just to relieve the love of Mr Morey and Sophia.

This is the first of Susanna Kearsley's books I read.  I found it as I was searching for another author and decided it sounded like a good read.  I enjoyed it so much that I am trying to find more of her works.  I haven't found any in the Kindle format, but am considering buying them in paperback if they are not put in the Kindle format soon.

I chose this novel first because it was compared to the novels of some of my favorite authors, Mary Stewart, Diana gabaldon, and daphne  De maurier. It was so totally unique a book with its plot and beautiful prose, that I was spellbound. I just could not put it down until I had learned the final truth of what had happened to Sophia and Moray.

I have to say I was a bit put off at first by the comparison to Diana Gabaldon and was concerned that this might be an imitation of her story and her style.  But this was not the case.  This story was its own magic.  I enjoyed every minute of its weaving between the times - here and in history.  It is well written and well researched.  Enjoy!

An intriguing look at history through the eyes of a beautiful Scottish lass.  Two love stories intertwined through real historical settings.  I won't give anything away, but if you love history and romance you should read this book.  I thank the author for being true to historical facts while still weaving an emotional and riveting storyline.

I decided to try this book because it was a Kindle summer special and had a 4.5 star rating. I was captivated! I have never read anything by Susanna Kearsley before, but "Winter Sea" was well-written with a double-story line that draws the reader into it. Fascinating - the kind of story that will stay with you after you've closed the cover.

Romance, history, the Scottish coast - this is definitely a book to stay up late with. I love historical fiction in general, and appreciate the detail in this well-told tale. Tying the past and the present together through the lens of both the narrator and her ancestor works well here. Looking forward to reading more from this author!

I read this book based on a recommendation from Barnes and Noble's book critic.  Otherwise, I must admit that I probably would have passed this one up.  I'm so glad that I didn't!  I found Sophia and Moray's love story to be more compelling than Jack and Rose in Titanic.  This book would translate into a wonderful motion picture.

Enthralling characters, authentic settings, and exhilarating, historic plotlines. Kearsley is now one of my favorite authors along with Austin, Auel, and Gabaldon. Who hasn't dreamed about time travel! If you love historic romance novels, you need to add The Winter Sea, The Rose Garden, The Firebird, and Mariana to your wish list.

Loved this book, I'm an avid reader and it's difficult to find a really well written romance with a plot that hasn't already been used a hundred times but this book was a very pleasant surprise. Loved the duel storylines. If you are like me and always on the hunt for a good romance to enjoy I think you will really enjoy this book.

Very nice , the pace was slow and  a lot of the scenes felt repetitive but the story , the way the author has recreated the different eras in parallel was brilliantly executed. The language was poetic almost. I enjoyed it so much that I downloaded Mariana by the same author and am rather savouring it now. Definitely worth a read.

SOmetimes I felt like I was drowning in detail and in the lives of people I began to not care about. The book needed a diet or to be much shorter for me to continue the interest it had in the beginning. Some concepts and scenes were great and others just dragged....I will read the author again but I am not raving about this one.

If you have enjoyed OUTLANDER, you must read A WINTER SEA,  It's one of those that is impossible to put down...it carries you through every emotion...and you fall completely in love with the main characters.  Take a moment to immerse yourself in the wonders that are Scotland and in this marvelous story that will warm your heart.

Kearsley may be compared to many other authors but her writing is wonderful in its own right. I was nervous that the story would be another time travel plot but was pleasantly surprised by the current day setting. The author easily transitions between the two leading ladies and intertwined their lives beautifully. A lovely read.

I just finished this book, and it was amazing.  I couldn't put it down from the moment I picked it up!  One of the best books I've read in quite a while. Now I'm off to look up Ms. Kearsley's other novels!  If you enjoy the Scottish/English history of the early 18th century, and like some romance thrown in, this book's a winner!

I really enjoyed this book.  The characters were vivid, the history was accurate, and it was very romantic.  There also was an element of mytery that kept me turning the pages.  I haven't read much historical fiction lately but I was glad I read this book.  The author has written other books and I look forward to reading them.

I bought this book to have something to read on the train, since I do enjoy historical fiction.  I hadn't finished it by the time I got home and couldn't do anything else until I had.  WOW, amazing book, took my breath away!  I haven't been as entranced by a novel for a long, long time.  Now I'm looking into her other works.

When I first picked up this book I expected it to be an average historical fiction novel. When began reading I realized how wrong I had been. This book is outstanding. The way the author weaves the two story lines together is fantastic. I would recommend this book to any book lover not just a lover of historical fiction.

Susanna Kearsley is one of the best time-travel/ancestral memory authors out there. She knows her history and she deftly weaves her characters into a full-blown people. You feel like you are there. This story is one of my favorite Kearsley books. If you love Diana Gabaldon and Barbara Erskine, you will love this book.

This is a beautifully written novel, with haunting descriptions of scenic Scotland, riveting history and intrigue, and a beautiful romance. The characters were thoughtfully developed. The historical story of the Jacobite Rebellion of 1708 was fascinating, and as much a part of the pleasure of reading as the romances. Perfection!

Great book! A historical novel embedded in a novel - nice twist. I enjoyed both plot lines and the author did a good job with characterization. There were times where the retelling of history slowed down the book - otherwise I would have awarded 5 stars. Anyone that enjoys historical novels shouldn't miss this one!

a double romance written as a subconcious memory of events from the past, a unique way of presenting both stories.  A pleasant tale that grows on you and is a pleasant way to spent a day or two.  nice character development, believable.  I wanted to believe it was a true story :) and sweet it is. enjoy your read.

I tried to read this book many times and couldn't ever get into it.  I saw it on Audible and figured I should give it another try and I am so glad I did! This is an excellent book, the style and voice is wonderful.  I really enjoyed the story and would highly recommend it.  Great book, so glad I listened to it.

I had never read anything of Susanna Kearsley before buying this book.  I have to say I absolutely loved this story.  The author has a way of writing that makes you feel like you're living the story.  I have gone on to read 3 or 4 more of her books.  I did greatly enjoy them also but, this is still my favorite.

Having been to Scotland, this book reminded me very much of it.  And no wonder -- the author spent some time there when researching and writing it.  It's a pleasant time-warp / ghosty kind of romance without an ounce of scary, and I very much liked it and devoured it within two days.  Will probably read again.

I was captured by this historical, fictional novel and loved it! It was such a fascinating story, set in Scotland. It's a story based both "today" and the late 1600's, and although the pace is slow, it's a story that grabbed hold of me. It has been a long time since a story has haunted me until I finished it.

I love historical fiction and especially when books go from the present to the past.  It was fun because the book started with a women who writes historical fiction...........so the past was written by the main character in the present. A little predicatable, but worth every minute. I was sorry when it ended.

A great marriage of fiction and historical events.  Lovely description of the NE coast of Scotland, so well expressed it left me wanting to see it for myself.  I was very intrigued with the possibility of (parapsychology) genetic memory, paired with genealogical research.  A notion well done by this writer .

This was a wnoderful book! I could hardly put it down and  I read it in 2 days! The characters were real, the locations were real and all jumped right off the page! I especially liked the ending.....nice way to surprise readers!  I highly recommend this book to any lover of historical fiction. It was GREAT!

As soon as I started reading this book, it was hard to put down.  I had initially been hesitant to read it, seeing as I am not a huge fan of history, let alone Scottish history.  I was however, pleasantly surprised at how enthralling the whole story was from start to finish.  You will not be disappointed!

This is a really captivating book. I'd never read any of Kearsley's work before, so I wasn't sure I'd like it, but she did a great job. The only thing that ever pulled me out of the story was the comma usage. Commas commas everywhere! Lol. But the writing was great and the story compelling. Give it a go!

This Book was AWESOME! Totally intriguing with it's twists and turns, I'm not going to give anything away here - as SO many reviewers do - but if you love good historical fiction, this is one of them, has just the right amount of mystery, love, happiness, sadness and history.  I couldn't put it down....

I loved this book.  I read it on my kindle in a very short period of time.  Didn't want to put it down.  I have read the Outlander series so the Scottish history drew me in first.  Then both the past and present romances.  I think I fell just a little in love with both John and Graham.  My kind of book.

This book was fantastic; I highly recommend it! The characters were engaging and full of life. The story line was intriguing and moved seamlessly between two time periods. I couldn't wait to see how it would end, and yet didn't want it to be over. I look forward to more books by this author. Well done!

I thoroughly enjoyed this book, and when I was done went back and retread some of historical chapters, since they were so captivating. One thing I didn't understand: on the back it talks about something destroying her (being the author). I didn't get that sense, perhaps it was a sensational comment.

This book grabbed my interest from page 1.  There is something here for most everyone - mystery, intrigue, history, suspense, and romance.  The characters come to life as you read.  I won't be ready to read another book for awhile because the characters and the story from this book linger in my mind.

I really enjoyed the characters and descriptions.  At first I though the whole writing about an author thing was cliche, but I ended up enjoying that character too.  Sometimes the whole memory thing is a little overdone, but I am a reluctant reader and was interested--at time mesmerized--throughout!

This did not hold my attention. Truth is I deleted it somewhere in the middle. I love the outlander series and I had hoped to find something that at least felt like it. This did not do the trick. The story is not bad and the writing is fine it just doesn't hold a candle to books like outlander.

This book was hard to put down, the characters were rich, coming alive under the author's skilled hand. It contained all the elements of a good book, mystery, romance, history, and a castle set against the sea. I hated for the surprising but satisfying end. Will be reading more of this author!

I have always been a huge fan of Diana Gabaldon's "Outlander"  series and was very thrilled to find another author's work so much like hers in Suzanna Kearsley. Looking forward to another of Kearsley's reads! The touch of the mystical and implasible is just enough for a very satisfying escape.

Very much in the vein of Diana Gabaldon, but with perhaps more accuracy. Beautifully written, Sophia's story is heart-wrenching. I found Carrie's story nearly extraneous but it ties up a loose end and, for that, it's worth it. Kearsley's research is extremely thorough and I applaud her that.

I just finished this novel a few days ago. It was a completely captivating and intriguing read. The characters and storyline are thoroughly engaging. By the end I had tears in my eyes...a very satisfying and enjoyable read, without drifting too far into the realm of complete implausibility.

The book was wonderful, the first that I have read from Suanna Kearsley and now I can't wait to read the rest of her work.  I could not put the book down and the rest of my life went right on by while I read.  I am already telling all of my friends about it and I just finished it tonight.

I happen to love the specific time in history that is covered in this story - this was written even better than I thought it might be - I so enjoyed every moment and would recommend it highly!  I had to limit myself to 2 chapters a day or I would not have put it down until I finished it.

The history and depth of knowledge that goes into this book are amazing. I knew little of the Jacobites and this was a grand introduction to learning more. I love the idea that the history comes from the actual writing of our heroine. Treat yourself. Along w/ Marianna this is a favorite.

I felt the story line--once established--was pretty predictable and some events felt very contrived. And--spoiler alert--the ending sequences regarding little Anne were not believable or even understandable. I kept reading just because I was too lazy at the time to find another book.

This story seamlessly travels back and forth in time, between the story teller and the story. A mix of romance, history, happy, and sad, all set in the wonderful country of Scotland. An interesting way to pass the hours. I enjoyed it every bit as much as reading "Outlander."

Loved it!  I'll not re-cap as plenty of others have done, but will say this book grabbed me from beginning to end.  Well researched, beautiful flow, engaging story line makes this one a worth while read.  Would love a sequel, and will be purchasing other books from this author.

I am just  reading Chapter 10 of THE WINTER SEA , but I already know that I love this story! The writing is so well done; I am trying to read slowly, but I am having a hard time putting it down! I think that if you like historical fictional much as I do, you will like this book!

This is the third Susanna Kearsly book I have read and so far my MOST favorite. It was wonderful!!!! The war/battle/invasion that was going on was a bit confusing at times but I was still able to follow and enjoy. I felt so much emotion and loved the characters. Thanks Susanna!!

It ia always a pleasure to read an extremely extensively research historical romance, especially when the story is so well written. The history adds to the story, being neither too textbook nor slight. One of the best historical romances I have ever read. A credit to the genre.

The comparison to Diana Gabaldon sparked my attention, but this story stands on its own.  The author did a beautiful job weaving the stories together and I couldn't stop the tears from falling toward the end of the story.  A very rewarding read and one I hope to visit again.

The author does a very nice job with this story within a story.  Good historical context for interest, plenty of drama and heartbreak, but also a good dose of romance.  It's not one of the best of the genre that I've read, but it certainly made for a quick, enjoyable read.

I had some difficulty connecting with this story at first. By the middle, I found myself enjoying it very much. I was surprised by how lyrical her writing could be, sometimes rereading passages because they struck me so.  Not to give anything away, but I loved the ending!

Well written.  It grabbed my interest right from the beginning and pulled me right through it. I love the romance and the mystery and the ending.  It's fun to learn some history in a good story.  This was my second reading of this book and eventually I will read it again.

I began this book with the intention of having an easy read, I was happy to find out that it wasn't an easy read but one that grabbed and held me till it was completed.  Loved the way the author wrote and will be searching for her other works.  So thank you Ms. Kearsley.

I must admit I am not one to read a novel with so much historical reference.  That being said, the author balanced the historical information and the past and present stories so well that I could not put the book down!  I am looking forward to reading more of her books!

Ms Kearsley has a deft way of crafting a story, bringing the reader into her characters' lives so completely.  I havent cried while reading a story in a while, but this had me so engrossed.  Fear not! The ending is a happy one.  I wish sh'd write another one like this.

It has been a while since a book has brought me into it fully, and this one definitely succeeded. The story is presented in a way that as a reader you are learning the history along with the characters and therefore feel a part of the story as well. A delightful read.

I can honestly say I have read hundreds of books but I can't say any of them made me have so much emotion.  I felt like part of the life of Sophia and hurt when she did and felt joy when she did.  What a great read!  I will certainly be reading more from this author.

I really enjoyed this story. She did a great job of writing both the present and past story. They both held my interest. I enjoyed learning about the 1708 rising. This is one of the few books that I really liked the ending. This is my favorite Susanna Kearsley book.

I wasn't sure if I'd like the back and forth between modern day and her historical subjects, but it worked- other than my questioning the constant zombie state that so many sleepless nights would bring about. The twist at the end added a satisfying ending. Good book

Didn't start out planning to read a romance, but a unique twist on historical fiction.  Was disappointed at lack of character development in the parts that were set in historical Scotland.  Some interesting twists toward the end lift the book up in a positive way!

I really loved this book.  I love historical fiction and this book really held my interest and it also had a great modern day love story intermixed within it.  If your looking for a great, long, romantic historical fiction book add this book to your reading list.
