If you read books from both the UK and the US - this book was originally titled SOFIA'S SECRET in the UK -- since it was not cross referenced I re-bought the book under the new title Winter Sea -- it is a very good read as are all of S.K.'s books  happy reading

This is a well-written, old-fashioned story with a satisfying twist at the end.  It combines a current story with a story from the past with just a touch of the otherworldly to keep one engaged.  It is a great book to read by the fire on a cold and stormy day.

I could not put this book down.  I loved everything about it, from the characters  to the location to the way it was written. It almost felt like I was living in the early 1700s.  The historical accuracy is amazing.  Loved the ending which was so unexpected.

This is an excellent story - a very engaging read. It's obviously fiction, but still the historical elements of the story seemed very real and well-researched. A quick(ish) fun read - the font's a pretty decent size too, so might be good for older eyes...

This was a hard book for me to get into. The story is about an author who is writing a book. The book then takes you within the book that the character is writing. It makes it difficult to follow 2 stories. I wished there was only one storyline, not two.

Such a beautiful and well-written story.  I was hesitant to read this at first but so glad I did.  While I guessed the end, it was simply only due to my desire for a HEA.  And, I was absolutely rewarded with a wonderful ending for both Sophia and Carrie.

I really liked this book, and admire the amount of research that went into writing it. It made me really want to go and tour Scotland, and I am now planning a trip there. The only thing I regret is there is not a sequel, please Susanna, write a sequel!!

Recieve the book and started it immediately. I did so enjoy the book. Very interesting with all its twists and turns. It has history, romance, suspense keeps you reading from page to page to see what will happen. I think you would enjoy this book also.

I don't enjoy reading history or sappy love stories and this was neither. Just enough history to keep it believable and I like how it was tied to the present, I couldn't put the book down. I really enjoyed the story  and thought it was well written.

It is rare you find a book that once you finish it, you can't stop thinking about it.  This was one of those books.  I had a hard time starting a new book, because nothing seemed to satisfy me.  Nothing was living up to how this book made me feel.

I absolutely loved this book.  The writing was superb and the characters seemed to step out of the pages of the book.  Suzanna Kearsley makes you think you are there seeing and being the characters.  Always enjoyable but this one was really good!

i loved this book...but then i have loved knowing this author and the books she brings to us.  I think this book is my favorite, i encourage the reading of her books and dont want to give away and plots.....just pick the book up and begin to read

Another compelling installment of Jacobite history as seen through the eyes of a young orphaned lass named Sophia. I did not read these in the order the author intended, but wasn't confused or lost in the plot. They are solid stand alone novels.

Everything I love about historical fiction was here.  I found myself repeatedly looking up additional info on some of the characters presented, wanting to confirm that they were not fictional. Loved the back and forth between past and present.

I loved this story.  Mystery, love, and history - what more could you ask for.  The author tells a wonderful story weaving present and past together seamlessly.  I have recommended this book  to several of my friends and they loved it as well!

It is rare for a writer to endear characters enough to me to move me to cry for them. This book made me cry, that's how wonderful the story is. I could feel myself there in a tiny village in Scotland. Excited to read more of Susanna's books.

But, in light of that, it is a bit too reminiscent of The Outlander series in it's plot line. That being said it's a fantastic and quick read! Happy both love stories worked out in the end! I will definitely seek to read more from Kearsley.

Read it for book club and everyone liked the historical aspect of the book as well as the characters but especially how the author went back and forth from the present to the past. Several looked up the locations in Scotland from the book.

I got this as a kindle freebie, but would have paid the full price. I was so engrossed in this book, i could not put it down. Her writing style is fantastic, the characters written so deeply. Looking forward to reading more by this author.

I knew little of the Jacobites and loved the narrative that sent me off to look up details.  The plot, thankfully wasn't predictable--which helped me overcome my typical aversion love story themes, and which were only a tiny bit overdone.

What a wonderful book. Full of history, intrigue, suspense, excitement and a wonderful love story. I laughed, cried and bit my nails. The author wrote so well that I felt like I was in all the scenes  and part of the action. A great read

A lovely elegiac story, with history, characters, and tremendous atmosphere. This is not a book for those who need fancy plot devices. It's more a study of the character of a certain point in time and how that translates to the present.

I love historical fiction and I really loved The Winter Sea.  I enjoyed having an inside view from the writer's perspective as to how she constructed the story.  Enjoyed the parallels of the 2 stories and recommend it for a great read!

I absolutely LOVED this book. If I was to write a book I would want it to be like this. It was just a wee bit softer at times than it could be, but all the same, it was creative, well written and compelling. I very highly recommend it.

If you like historical fiction and chic lit, this is for you. A romantic tale with a mixture of modern times and history, this boom was everything I needed it to be. I cried. I yelled for joy. It was very emotional, and a lovely read.

This was a great read. It was full of interesting Scottish history from the early 1700s, which even my history loving boyfriend was unaware of. Great plot twist at the end, too! Best book I've read in ages, and I read A LOT of books!

I enjoyed this book.  Moving back and forth between past and present can be confusing, but Ms. Kearsley handles it well.  I appreciate her attention to detail and her adherence to historical accuracy. I plan to read more of her work.

Not since the Outlander series have I read such an enjoyable epic which transports me to another place and time.  I appreciate that she tells a compelling, spell-binding story without resorting to graphic details of sex and violence.

Delicately interwoven tales of love and intrigue. It's rare to find this kind of expert storytelling in one novel...this author combines two novels into one heart wrenching tale. I loved it! Can't wait to read more by this author.

What a wonderful book! Trust me, you want to read this. It's really two books in one, interrelated, and connected in fascinating ways. This book is going on my keeper shelf, where it will be read again and again through the years.

This book is a combinatin of histoical fiction and chick-lit.  It strikes the right balance and is an engaging story.  Despite it's lenght, I breezed through it and couldn't put the book down for most of the 2nd half of the story.

Have read all of this authors books and The Winter Sea and The Rose Garden are by far the best!  Other books by this author do not rate and do not compare to the two books noted.  Wish I had known so I could have saved the money.

This book kept my interest from page one. You'll witness a story spanning three hundred years as a writer finds her inspiration through the eyes of an ancestor. The secondary characters are lovable and neatly done. A good read.

This book was AWESOME.  I read it after I had read Marianna (also an excellent book.)  In the last few pages of The Winter Sea I went from weeping to shouting and back again.  This book is a seamless read and kept me up nights!

History was interesting and the format was skillfully done, as moving between narratives did not bother me as a reader. However, the endless prattle from the main character about being a writer and her methods was off putting.

Fluffy, flowery, and slow moving. It was like being inside the mind of a never-married 50 year old woman with way too much sexual desire bottled up. No plot that I could discern. If you like romance novels you might like this.

This is my first Susanna Kearsley book and all I can say is "Wow!".  I have been looking for a long time for another great historical fiction writer.  I can hardly put this one down.  Can't wait to read some of her other work.

I enjoyed this book very much! The story was artfully woven so that the two story lines - the historical part and the present day - flowed naturally and seamlessly. I look forward to reading more of Susanna Kearsley's novels.

This book is cleverly conceived and well written. It took me a little while to get into the story but once I did, I could not put it down. The story is beautiful and the characters come alive. It was a great pleasure to read.

I love historical fiction, and am always looking for new material.  I am so glad to have found The Winter Sea.  I recommend it to anyone who enjoys a wonderfully written story with an interesting twist.  Well worth the time!

I loved this book.  The characters are well-developed and the story charming.  Be sure to read The Firebird as well, since some of the same characters are in that book.  These two books will both be in our favorites library!

Very enjoyable book with a very satisfying, unexpected ending.  At first the shifting between stories aggravated me but its necessary and eventually it became more fluid for me.  Stick with it and you won't be disappointed.

I just finished The Winter Sea and was pleased with this author!  Fortunately, also bought The Firebird and The Rose Garden, so I'm set for the next two weeks!  Susanna Kearsley is a fabulous writer and has a new fan in me!

I finished this book today and have yearned to revisit it already.  It is a beautiful story based on true facts which makes it hit the heart so much harder.  My first time reading Susanna Kearsley, it will not be my last.

This was my first novel by this author. I loved the way she told the story from the perspective of a writer involved in writing a new book. The characters were clearly drawn and both stories existed successfully together.

I'm not going to give you the plot...there are plenty here who've done just that and I was glad that I hadn't read the reviews before buying this for my Kindle. I will just say that I loved it and that I hope you do, too.

I don't know what to say. It really drew me in, and I felt like i was living in the story.  I was very sad to see it end as the world I was living in then had to end. But it is a Beautiful book, one I read over and over.

I was hoping to find a new author since I have finished all the Outlander books. This was a good book, but not of the same quality. I liked the dual periods, but found some of the historical accounts long and drawn out.

I loved this book. It has two related stories going at once, one in the present and one in the past, and I loved each one. The characters are memorable and the writing well done. It was a book I didn't want to put down.

I really enjoyed this novel. I love any story within a story kind of book, it's like it takes you one layer farther away from reality. The paranormal element was handled really well. I am reading the sequel right now :)

My favorite book written by Susanna Kearsley. I read it a couple of years ago and just read it again and enjoyed it as much and will read it again in a couple of years. It is a book that draws you in and a page turner.

I was spellbound from page one.  I loved the way she described everything in such vivid detail. I learned things about Scottish history that I didn't know. And the love story was so sweet.  Thank you for a great story.

Exceptional writing. Its pacing and tone captures the imagination like a heat seeking missile. Makes me want to curl up in a window seat on a cold and rainy day with a blanket, a glass of wine and this wonderful story.

This book is beautifully researched and written. I have read it again and again, and given it as gifts to several people (who have also thoroughly enjoyed it.) Can't recommend it enough for fans of historical fiction!

I really enjoyed the book. It was well written and entertaining. It was fairly predictable and I pretty much knew how it was going to go the whole time, but I still enjoyed seeing how it developed to get to that end.

Once again Ive been transported and elevated to a time and life that left me breathless. So many feelings and experiences.... with characters that take you in to a magnificent world. A treasure in my book collection.

I laughed and I cried.  Flawless characters and plot, and loved the weaving in of history.  Thoroughly enjoyed it and am looking forward to another.  Very much like Du Maurier who I also love.  I would read it again.

I absolutely loved The Rose Garden and then thoroughly enjoyed this book.  Susanna Kearsley is now one of my favorite authors.  This book is so innovative for a historical novel and I savored it from start to finish.

What can I say that hasn't already been said? I am thankful to have read such a stunning and magnificent book. I cannot wait to read more, but I always keep Sophia and Carrie's story with me. Beautiful beyond words!

Susanna weaves a compelling tale between the historic past and the present. And, she does it without losing the reader's interest in what happens next in Sophia's story and Carrie's quest for the truth. Great read.

I would say that by the second page in, Iknew this would be a tough book to put down. It is such a wonderful blend of history, suspence, mystery with a tad of romance thrown in. I would highly recommend this book.

The idea of this was more intriguing than the execution. Not enough tension in the main characters' life (past and present) to give her (them) depth. I wanted to feel both women struggling more against something.

I truly enjoyed this book. The visual descriptions were incredible - I loved the scenery depicted. This book brought with it a great historical education as well! The Winter Sea is certainly not a book to miss.

I thought this was a really good read with lots of history.  Loved the ending, and the characters have stayed with me.  This is the first of the author's books that I have read and will definitely read others.

I loved this book and it developed in me a desire to visit Slains Castle one day. The sequel was good as well (I can't remember the name) but bottom-line I recommend this good to any historic fiction readers.

This was an absolutely fantastic book! I literally stayed up way past my bedtime until I finished! I wasnt sure how the 2 books in one idea would work but Ms. Kearsley made is seamless. I LOVE THIS STORY!!!!

First off I loved kearsleys writing style and I love that we got to read her characters book. Who thinks of that?! I was glad to see how the book ended, I did a little happy dance even. Overall great novel

Wonderful tale! Loved the historical facts and the ties to current generations. The historical love story was more compelling than the current one but then isn't all historical romance better than current.

Kearsley captures her readers and takes them back in time to explore the Scottish countryside and its history with beautiful prose and the bonus of romance.  It is a delight to become lost in these pages.

I can't recall what I expected when my friends suggested this book, but it was simply wonderful. I learned quite a bit about a time period I knew nothing about AND got the bonus of a beautiful love story.

I read over 500 pages a week in all genres and I thoroughly loved this book!  I recommend it to anyone who loves an interesting plot, historical fiction, and interesting characters - one of my favorite :)

My normal rating for a truly good book is a 4.  I rarely rate a book at 5, as I feel that should be reserved for something exceptional and in my opinion "The Winter Sea" by Susanna Kearsley is just that.

I wish there were more books like this one.  It engaged me from the start and, just like the narrator/writer in the story, I was taken over by the characters.  I hope to read more of this author's work.

A clever mix of history and fiction. It keeps the reader engaged and spins a romantic love story too! I didn't notice that this is a long story because it flowed well. I would highly recommend the book.

I really enjoyed this book.  It is well written, historically accurate and the transitions between time periods is well done. One of the better books i've read lately and one I'll recommend to friends.

This novel is just a plain GOOD story!  The two plots are interwoven very nicely; the suspense is good; ending unpredictable; and just a fine, fine read for a gloomy fall day.  I would give it 8 stars.

Loved this novel, enjoyed the style, would recommend it to anyone who likes history thrown in with a bit of time travel, gentleman lovers, touching and so comfortable read.  Yes, it's good, very good.

Ho delightful to two tales to read simultaneously.  A successful weaving of the stories and history.  A delightful look of the wild country of Scotland and the people that made it so.  Very good read.
My first Susanna Kearsley read and I thought it was really quite excellent. The story-line was interesting and I felt moved by her characters. I liked it so much that I am on to read her other books.
There are two somewhat parallel stories intertwined that are connected through an author's "genetic memory". It's a well written book that takes the reader to Jacobean Scotland during the revolution.
I can't remember when I've  become so involved with the characters and a period of history  as in this book.  A page turner from the very beginning. The time travel aspect is so real and believable.
I truly enjoyed this story within a story concept. The author creates such vivid characters, it was hard not to become completely invested in them. Fast read as it kept my interest hour after hour.
From the moment I started reading this book, I couldn't stop! Her writing style is easy to follow and the plot was always exciting. No doubt, this book has been added to my all-time favorite books!
Loved the character building and overlap through time. Never a slow section, kept me engaged from page one. Thank you to the author for bringing this history and the stirring relationships to life
I love a little real history mixed with fiction. It made for a fun read with a lot of charming characters that you actually miss when you put the book down.  I hope she writes many more like this.
This book entertained front to back, with engaging characters and an interesting historical setting. Think about spending a rainy, cold afternoon curled up with a hot drink and this terrific book!
I would call this book good chewing gum for the eyes. Easy to read, like the historical information and the characters. For me it was an entertaining, enjoyable, G rated, Romantic Historical novel
WOW, WHAT AN INCREDIBLE STORY! I had trouble following the historical parts, but it didn't matter...the story drew me in like a fly in a spider's web. Be prepared to become completely enthralled!
Loved it, whoever said that "nothing happens" in this book was wrong! True, it was a little slow to start, but the end was heart wrenching and has a twist that I did not see coming. A must read!
Not many people can carry off two simultaneous characters within a  book. She does it well! I couldn't put the book down and (when I did have to) I was constantly thinking about the characters.
First book I have by Susanna Kearsley. I have not been disciplined yet to finish it but when reading I truly relish in her writing style. I am quite fond of it so far. Will come back for more.
This was my first taste of susanna and I loved it. The story was sweet. There was a little bit of history, romance, and mystery. I enjoyed reading it and it was a quick read. My kind of book!
The story it's self is so easy to get into.  I could not wait to get to the next chapter.  A little history,suspense and being drawn in and feeling like I was part of the story.  I loved it.
This book had interesting history that I knew nothing about, and I like the past alternating with present story lines. I especially loved the story and characters from the past in this one.
The author did a nice job of interweaving past and present in this book. The historical topic was very interesting and storyline (although somewhat predictible) was good. Highly recommend!
I was expecting this book to be entertaining.  I didn't expect it to be as solidly written, interesting, and enthralling as I found it to be. I'm impressed and highly recommend this read!
Wonderful engaging story - didn't want to put it down.  She really brings the characters to life and blends the past and the present with seamless effort.  I will get more of her books.
I enjoyed this book.  I like the author going back and forth in time and thought the plot developed nicely.  It was a quite satisfying read and it made me look for another book by her.
This historic romantic novel, is a book you can get lost in. Great storyline, educational and entertaining. Should not miss this one. Imaginative and is downloadable to Kindle reader.
A superb read, just the right mix of history and fiction. I haven't read a book this wonderful in quite a while. I look forward to reading more by this author because now I'm hooked!

A great listen, since i got the audible version 1st....actually a wonderful story within a story. i have really liked all of Ms Kearsley's books that i have listened to so far, and looking forward to the few i have left....had have the kindle version just in case i get the chance to actually read it for myself. Definitely a story re-read or listen to again and characters to revisit!
Truly enjoyed the mix of past and present of the story line. I found this book very refreshing and enlightening. Loved the historical aspect intertwined with the present day story!
I am always looking for a well written fiction placed in a location and time that is historically correct.  I enjoyed this book enough that I have purchased another by this author.
I enjoyed this book very much. A very detailed book about the history of The Scottish resistance to the union to England, and the characters that helped make the story come alive.
Kept me captivated from the beginning. I loved the dual story line. The book was well-written and taught me a bit of history while keeping me entertained. I'd recommend this read.
A mesmerizing blend of fiction, Jacobite history, and romance. Kearsley's evocative writing draws you in from the first page and doesn't let go until the end. Highly recommended.
The depth of history is so easily translates on to the page and let's the readers imagination transport them through time.  My first book by the author but certainly not my last
A wonderful story, beautifully told with powerful prose...and I even understood and loved the sometimes Doric dialogue.  Get it and curl up for a read that will be hard to beat.
What a beautiful book. There was great magic in these pages that grabbed my heart and held on till the last page. Take the time to read this one, you will be very glad you did.
You dive into this book and don't come up again till the very end. When you surface and take a Deep breath you know you have travelled  a long way. This book is a great read.
This wonderful heart rendering story is filled with history and passion.  I thoroughly enjoyed every aspect of it.  An engaging story well told.  Thank you Susanna Kearsley!
Historical fiction with genealogy masterfully woven through as this story spans the centuries. There's something to be said for ancestral memory... I couldn't put it down.
I enjoyed this book and found the history of the Jacobite invasion interesting. Cullen Bay sounds very beautiful and the narrative told between time periods was well done.
Susanna blends the past and present beautifully in the historical fiction.  The characters come alive and entice you to continue reading-even past the ending of the story.
Such true characters...such beautiful words rarely bely historical fiction to the point of this well done page-turner.  Now I need the hardback to savor as a true classic
Beautifully researched, and written. I lived the story, and wished that "time" passed more slowly. Being of Scotch decent, I felt that I was reading my family's history.
I have always been fascinated by the prospect of ancestral memory. Susanna Kearsley has done a wondeful job of mixing history with a great present day story. Nicely done
Excellent writing of historical facts makes very good reading.  Thoroughly enjoyed her style of writing so much that I bought some of her other books and loved them too!
I am reading this one now and it is great .I was a bit disappointed in the waiting time for this order as my other order was very quick . but the book,s are great /////t
I very much enjoyed reading this book. The historical details and interesting plot kept me riveted. The grammar was not always correct, which I found slightly annoying.
I really loved it, the history always facinates me and the romance keeps me wondering what will come next. I loved the way it was intertwined with the past and present.
My first historical romance, and I loved it!  The author does a wonderful job pulling you into the story and bringing the characters to life.  And what a clever ending!
The book was a bit slow to start but once I read past the first few pages I couldn't put it down. I wish it didn't end. I'll be looking for more books by this author.
I loved the blend between history and modern life. I especially appreciated her recap of the history of the Jacobites  and King James. It increased my understanding.
Characters were excellent.  Loved the unique way the past and present were combined.  Would recommend for anyone who likes historical fiction and a sweet love story.
Her excellent juxtaposition of the past to present kept me captivated to the plots unfolding. It will also leave you emotionally spent. I highly recommend this novel
She has many interesting things to say about writing itself and how she comes up with characters and lets them talk. I like the parallel lives. I recomend this book.
This is a book within a book, and both are captivating. The author draws her characters vividly, and the history upon which the inner story is based is fascinating.
One of the best historical romances I`ve read.  Very much in the tradition of Mary Stewart.  The idea of genetic memory is very intriging and a great plot device.
It has been years since a book has so hooked me. I held my breath, I shed tears, and I felt the joy. That is everything and more I could ever ask of a great story.
The writing is well done, the story is fascinating and well researched and kudos to whomever edited it!  This was a pleasure to read and sorry to reach the ending.
This was a amazingly good book - the first I have read by this author, but sure not to be the last!  It is absolutely full of history, and has a great story line.
I just really enjoyed the story, it was like sitting down and listening to someone tell it to you, with the closeness that comes with it. Thank you To the author.
Liked this book from first page. Didn't want to put it down. Usually read mysteries but this was better than a lot of those I have read. Already have the sequel.
I am owed half a box of tissues. You'll all just have to read this book to understand why. A really good historical romance with just a touch of the paranormal .
Very well written, a novel within a novel.  Historically exciting and educational.  Very heartwarming and touching.  A story you will want to read over and over.
Loved it!  Historical, exciting, and  a love story all mixed together.  Spell binding with great descriptions of the countryside in Scotland.  Really enjoyed it!
Very intriguing writing style and Scottish historical slant of a story making it most interesting read. If you like history, ancestry, and romance, you'll enjoy.
This is my first Kearsley novel and I am pleasantly surprised! Novel is beautifully written! The characters and scenery are both well defined. Excellent writer.
Not quite Gabaldon storytelling, but it will still whisk you away! Always appreciate when the author does his/her history homework also. Great, romantic escape!
This book has everything I love.  History. Romance, and appreciation of how much research goes into writing this book.  I will be checking out her other books.
Probably my favorite romantic historical fiction ever. But wait this review needs to be longer, then I will say this book haunted me for ages after I read it.
I thoroughly enjoyed this book. Very well researched and well written. If you enjoy history past and present with a touch of romance, you will love this book.
I was so surprised with this book. I absolutely fell in love with the characters....and in return they made me laugh at times and cry with sadness at others.
If you love Outlander this is a great book. You'll love it too.  The premise is great and the characters are awesome  I will be checking out her other books!
Well rounded characters with insite into the writing process. Also well grounded in history. A worthy and pleasurable reading experience and time investment
Wonderful book! Well written and informative, as well as entertaining. I was so glad the ending turned out the way it did. Looking forward to the next book.
This book offers many characters, both present day and historical. I loved being in Scotland. Easy to wrap myself in a blanket and take a wonderful journey.
I loved this book.  I have read several of Susanna Kearsley's books and this was my favorite.  It stayed wiht me after I shut the book...always a good sign!
I am so sad to see this story end. I fell in love with the characters and the story of their lives. I laughed and cried right along with Sophie and Carrie.
Great book! Makes me wish to see Scotland , an amazing take with a twist. How much of our life is pre ordained , and how much of our past " bleeds through"
It was a great read loved it from start to finish even when it had me in tears. love the fact that the author tried to find actual facts on her characters.
I actually finished this last night, and was quite surprised that I really liked this.  I;m going to bother going into plot points, but this is a good read
I could not put the book down.  It was an intelligent, intriguing and hopelessly romantic read.  I enjoyed the historically based settings and characters.
A wonderful book! A great, continually progressing storyline and great character development. Nice historical details also. I highly recommend this book.
After being so disappointed with so many books lately, this was well written and finally what I was looking for. I will be reading more from this author.
I loved this book; I couldn't stop reading it! The writing is fluid and engaging. The details of the descriptions left me feeling like I was in Scotland.
One of my favorite books ever!  If you enjoy historical romance, this is a must read.  The concept of inherited memories is very interesting.
A riveting blend of the past and present as a writer researches and works on her novel. The description of genetic memory adds information and interest.
Great read!! Time travel or reincarnation? Loved the ending!! Historical and Romance. Love the writing style of her characters "talking" to her.
I laughed and cried reading this truly wonderful work of historical fiction, and characters with such depth! Looking forward to more for this author :)
I liked this book because I kept wanting to read more and not put it down . I have read it twice now and enjoyed it both times.it truly is captivating!
This book sends its way between the past and present as the main character writes a historical novel. It's an excellent read with a surprising ending.
A bit more of a romance novel than I would normally read, but well written and well plotted.  I enjoyed the historical settings for both time periods.
Could not put it down! Loved the interesting point of view bringing history to the present. Prompted research on my own of Slains Castle & King James!
I like historical fiction and this one supplied that with a different twist going between the present heroine's life and the fictional heroine's life.
My first Susanna Kearsley novel and it certainly won't be my last. I so enjoyed this book. I am looking forward to reading more of her work.
Really well written, although it seemed predictable and somewhat forced at the end. I did enjoy the book through out and wouldo definitely recommend!
Excellent pace, gripping plot, lovely, stays with you long after you finish the last page! Nice to get a drink of history along with a love story...
This book within a book was delightful and intriguing. I liked the way the author incorporates history wrapped in a story, wrapped in another story.
The historical facts intermingle with a fictional romance in a very satisfying way. The details give it credence and the sweet story delivers depth.
This is one of my favorite books of all times.  Perfect amounts of romance, history, and switching from NOW to THEN.  This author never disappoints!
I did not want this book to end!  Weeks after finishing, my mind kept going back to the story, wondering what was happening now. Haunted me forever.
i have read all of susanna kearsley's books and this was is the best. i just can't put her books down. great author who mixes history with romance.
I loved this book!  It was a great story, it contained history, romance, just wonderful.  Very different too.  I would recommend this over and over.
It was a beautiful book. Not many novels stay with me after I read them, but this one definitely has. I recommend it to anyone who loves Outlander.
Great historical fiction and relationship story that entwined her own book into the story.  Setting was interesting. Makes me want to travel there.
Well written and the characters were people I could care about.  Liked the ending. If you like Scottish history and romance you will enjoy it, too.
Love the premise of the book...such clever staging!  Can't wait to get to the next book!  Follow the story of Sophia as her descendant writes it...
Susanna Beardsley writes wonderful novels.  The Winter Sea is time well spent inside the pages of a book.  I promise you will not be disappointed.
Loved it! Love the book within a book and the historical accuracy of her story. Great characters who were well developed and endearing. Well done!
I feel in love with the characters right from the beginning.....they seem like "real" people.  The historical part was icing on the cake!!
Quick read very entertaining, although I  wish the characters has more depth.  I do like that this book was based off of actual events and people.
The Winter Sea is the type of historical fiction that draws you in from the first word. Weaving a story rich in detail, I never wanted it to end.
I very much enjoyed this book. In fact, I enjoyed it enough to write my first amazon review. I'm now interested in reading more from this author.
I loved this story! Kept me reading till the end. All the historical facts were great and I cried at the end when Sophia and John were reunited.
Wonderful romance, credible and frisson-inducing. The time travel for by writing is a best concept, and avoids many paddles.  Highly recommended
I fell in love with this book right away!  Such beautiful writing and fantastic characters.  I would absolutely love to see this book on film.
Loved this book, I just came back from Scotland reading and finishing this book while I was there made me think a lot about it's really history
The perspective with which this book is written is just so different from any other books I've read.  "Fascinating" is all I can say. Loved it!
This book is wonderful. It will make you wonder about your own ancestors and how your common DNA connects everything: especially your memories.
Amazing storytelling, sussana kersley is able to weave two completely different stories while keeping the reader engaged. Highly recommend it.

The author gives away in its entirely the whole rest of the hero/heroine story in ONE sentence nearly halfway through the book. So, I plowed through to the end and discovered that, indeed, the entire ending [to the detail] had been accurately laid out by that one unfortunate tell-tale sentence almost halfway through.  If you are somehow able to miss that particular sentence, you may find the book enjoyable and be able to experience some semblance of surprise to the ending.

This is my favorite Susanna Kearsley book by far, and one of my favorite novels overall. The story was so captivating, I read the entire book on a flight from Italy to the US without stopping (quickest flight ever!) The scene that Kearsley creates is so beautiful, you feel like you're there with the sea blowing in your face. She was able to weave the stories of the past and present together in a way that made sense and kept the reader turning the page. Her attention to detail made everything more interesting without drawing the story out and leaving the reader bored. I didn't want it to end!

The plot has been adequately reviewed, so I will not do that one more time...this is a magical book; it is as lyrical as music written by Puccini. There is an "adage" among writers: Make Every Word Count...this book is a perfect example of using words judiciously, effectively and...beautifully. This is a GORGEOUS book. I never wanted it to end, yet I wanted to keep starting it over so I could read it once again.  And, I will read it many times. I hope this very talented author gives us more soon.

** Some spoiler alerts** I absolutely loved this book.  I bought it on a whim as I love story lines set in Scotland with history in them.  After reading a few of the books in the Outlander series I was unsure how this would measure up.  With both books having an emphasis on the Jacobite uprisings I was uncertain if I could enjoy this as much as I wanted.  My hesitation disappeared after reading for a few minutes.  This is one of the most beautiful and touching stories I have read in some time.  I did not care for how easily the physician suggested genetic memory for the reason Carrie was remembering Sophie's life... it seemed too hard to believe, although I do understand providing an explanation for how she can know the memories of another person. I am not one to cry over books and movies but this book brought me to tears on more than one occasion.  Two of the occasions I could not hold back tears I was teased by my husband who has no love for reading as he tried to understand how I could derive pleasure from a story that reduced me to tears.  The descriptions of the circumstances that made me cry were so vivid and real that I could not help but get caught up in the story.  I struggled mightily with Sophie leaving her daughter to be raised by others -- I understand her desire to keep her child safe, but once the world believes her husband to be dead I cannot understand what danger the child would be in.  As a mother myself I went back and forth -- ensure the child's safety by leaving her to be part of another family or bring her and risk the chance the evil characters in the book would hunt them down to harm a child they did not even know existed... For me this was also hard to believe/comprehend.  I do also wish that more of the story line between Carrie and her love interest had a chance to be developed a little more.  There scenes together were few and far between and left me wanting to know more about them together.  All in all, my criticisms are few as I enjoyed this book more than I expected.  I had such a difficult time getting the characters out of my thoughts for the next day or two after reading the story.  I can't wait to read more by this author.

This was my first introduction to this author's work; and with that said be prepared to stay up late for a few nights to read this novel and get lost in the worlds that Susanna Kearsley has created. Told from several different points of view, she's created such a enviable, mysterious, and heart-aching romance against the backdrop of a little known course of historical events that once you get started, you will not want to put this down. It's hard to write a review without giving the story away, but be prepared with a box of tissues and faith in the author to create an ending that we've all expected since meeting the four main characters. If you pay close attention to how she weaves the two time periods together, you'll be able to come to the same conclusions I had about the ending and be satisfied with this amazing novel.

My book club picked this book and that's pretty much the only reason I read it.  It was ok. . . really just a glorified romance novel and I kept thinking that it was oddly similar to a VERY POPULAR novel written in 1992 about a time traveling woman in Scotland. .. . .maybe somebody's trying to cash in on anther's ultra lucrative idea?  It's bad enough that the writer of the original book that I'm talking about milked it way beyond the point of good reading with her many many sequels. . . .

I do not normally enjoy "romance novels" about orphaned girls with lots of hardship in their lives who suddenly come of age and meet the man of their dreams.  It's all too predictable, and not very entertaining.  I had hoped the sort of psychic connection between the heroine of this book and her ancestor would make it hold my attention, but I really had to ignore the "Oh, brother!" comments my brain kept making to get through it.

It sounds like reading two books in one would be confusing and hard o follow, but he author does an excellent job of transitioning between the two.  The fact that her novels are as historically accurate as possible only adds to the romance.

I love Susanna Kearsley books, but even though the history and atmosphere pulled me in, even though the characters were so memorable, this novel fell short in that it went round and round with a whole lot of heresay and no answer to the question of who caused the betrayal that the main character discovers.  I was confused.  Even so, I will give it 4 stars as I did absorb alot of wonderful Scottish history and the essence of the story was very good.

Absolutely enjoy the way Kearsley writes about history. She mixes fact with just enough fiction to not only keep you entranced by her characters but also excite you with all the action. Looking forward to reading more of her books.
Lengthy and predictable. Characters are mediocre at best. Had a very hard time finishing this read. I was hoping it would be more like Outlander, which I loved.
Typical love story witty some history thrown in.  Great for pure escape if you don't mind being able to predict the ending.

This was a book that I greatly enjoyed reading.  Ms. Kearsley touches the reader's emotions.  It isn't many authors who can bring me to tears, but Sophia's losses had me bawling.  Not that I enjoy a book because it makes me cry, but I liked this one in spite of it.  I am no expert but in my humble opinion this is a page-turner.  Thank you, Ms. Kearsley

This book truly transports you to another time and place. I felt as if I was living this story in the first peron, not reading about somebody else's journey. I lived this story from beginning to end. The writing is so exquisite it takes your breath away. Absolutely seamless. Without a doubt one of the best books I have read in years.....what a wonderful story and story teller. I will read this book many, many times I know. And I will read all her other books. It will be interesting to see if they are as good as this book. It was SO WONDERFUL!!! Many, many thanks to the author for such a beautiful story.

I would give this book 10 stars if I could. Possibly the best book I have ever read. A wonderful moving story with characters and history that come alive. Brings you through a whole range of emotions and the story sticks with you long after you have turned the last page. Thank you for this very memorable novel Susanna Kearsley.
awesome!

As soon as I finished the book I wanted to start reading it again. I loved every minute that I spent with Sophia. I wanted to hurry to the end to see what happened to her life, but at the same time I wanted the book to never end. I lovely and lively tale with an unexpected twist.
BORING!
Thanks

This book uses single quotation marks. And honestly, it's so distracting I just can't get past it. I'm sure the book is great - but even though the quotation thing is stupid, I can't get into the story because of it.

I have to echo many of the other negative comments made about this book.  I bought it based on the preponderance of positive reviews, but like the other one star reviewers, I found the characters uninteresting, the writing cliched, and the plot plodding.
Great
A little too much delving into the immorality of everyone at the court. It's interesting history, but clouded with too much cheap romance drama.
I really liked the book.  It is, perhaps, not perfect but very close to it.  A very good read.

Having just finished Echo in the Bone, I was desperate for another series just as good. I picked The Winter Sea based on reviews that it was similar to Outlander. This could not be further from the truth. The history in Winter Sea read like a text book. There are two romantic story lines in this book. One in the present, which is lacking, and one in the past, which has promise, but becomes boring. If you are looking for more history than romance, or action, then this is the book for you. Meanwhile I will keep searching for books to keep me occupied until Written in My Own Hearts Blood comes out next year.
ok

This is the story about an author named Carrie, who writes historical fiction novels. She travels to Scotland to research Slains Castle for her newest novel and to spend some time with her editor who lives there. While she is there the characters of her book come alive in her memory. She is actually remembering the life of her ancestor, Sophie Paterson and her marriage to John Murray. While writing her book she meets a man named Graham and a romance starts. "The Winter Sea" jumps back and forth from the story Carrie is writing to Carrie's life in the present as she writes the story. I enjoyed reading about Carrie's romance, but reading the parts that were Carrie's book bored me. In the end it turns out that Graham is actually a descendant of Sophie Patterson as well. Carrie and Graham are kissing cousins! Cool.... I guess?

Maybe it's just me, but I could not get into this book.  I kept reading and reading and nothing was happening, so I quit.  When the characters spoke with a Scottish accent and was written that way, you had to sit and figure out what the heck they were saying.  That would be worthwhile if they had anything to say that WAS worthwhile.  If I had stayed with this book, maybe it would have gotten better, but I had better things to do and better books to read than wait and find out.
What can I say. I love this book. It is such a great story and easy to fall for the characters.  I definitely recommend this book to anyone. You will love it too.
The author does a great job of helping the reader to fit right into the story. I really felt like I was there walking amongst the winter sea. Beautifully written.
Started it because I like historical fiction.  After several chapters I wondered if it was written for young adults, but no.  It's just boring.

I really liked both the stories carried forward in this one novel. The author has a unique sense of character, time and place. I can't give it five stars, however, because of the lack of morals of the heroine in the present day story who slept with the hero before marriage. It would have been a much more delightful story, in my opinion, to have both the hero and heroine waiting for a wonderful marriage, and perhaps showing that marriage. Elva Martin, President, South Carolina Chapter of American Christian Fiction Writers
Would have been only 1 star but I liked the book - agree with what most have said about it - but cannot loan it to my wife to read onto her Kindle device - ripoff - so will not recommend it!

This book is terrible.  Those who have ranked it with more stars need to read a SERIOUSLY good book - one well written and without cliche double plots.  The writing style is PAINFUL, something you would expect to see from a 9th grade creative writing class, forced and full of trite expressions.  The double plots that mirror each other are ridiculous and unimaginative - additionally, the "twist" is predictable.  I finished it hoping against hope that it would get better, but it certainly didn't.  Beyond disappointing.

I am very dissappointed in the shape of this book.  Even the used ones I purchased haven't been in this bad shape.  The book is old and worn and the pages are brown and musty.  It should have been sold for less and stated that it was in bad shape.
